text: Bottle from Bury Lane Farm Shop, Herts. Coffee with sugar and cream aroma. Some liquorice in the tail. Glossy black. Thick beige head. Medium bitter. Coffee (no sugar), liquorice, roast. Gains sweetness in the finish, tart berries. Underlying creamyness. Medium bodied. Watered down oil. Lively carbonation, potentially overly so. Low key but astringent finish. Decent enough but the amount of carbonation and astringent part mar it for me. Not as good as I remembered.
12oz bottle. Dark mahogany pour, full head that fades to a thin tan cap. Rich, roasted malt aroma. Roasted flavors, dark chocolate, hints of coffee. Medium bodied. Silky mouthfeel, drying finish.

35,5cl bottle at home. Appearance: dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma: toffee, coffee, soysauce, roasted malts, port and apple. Taste: medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of coffee, soysauce, butterscotch, dark bread, roasted malts, oats and some fruits. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and medium carbonation. Mouthfeel is a little weak

0,355l bottle. Thick black colour with long lasting stiff beige head. Aroma: Caramel, chocolate, slight roasted coffeebeans with nut and dark fruity notes and a little bit cheese tone. Complex. Taste: Sweet, full malty start with lots of toasty and slightly fruity tones in the sip with a decent bitter but soft mouthfeel and a little bit sourish oat side note. Has a sliky texture. Well balanced, complex but in a sophisticated way. Medium body with medium carbonation. Long gently sour/bitter and softly dry finish. Very well made beer.

35.5cl bittle thanks to SimonBlok. Pours a a jetblack colour with a small beige head. Aroma of port, roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice, candy sugar, bit fruity. Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter with a low dry finish. Notes of port, chocolate, liquorice, candy sugar, plums, raisins, roasted malts, dark malts, toffee. Texture oily to watery, light to medium bodied with medium carbonation

Pours black with a big, creamy looking, light tan head. The aroma is big on chocolate and licorice, along with toasted malts, nuts, and caramel. It is a lot like the aroma in a foreign stout. The taste is dry and with some sweetness. Some bitterness comes through late. Toffee and toasted malts are the strongest flavors. Lesser chocolate, nuts, bread, mild herbal hops, and hints of licorice make up the undertones. Licorice and toffee aftertaste. Medium in body, chewy in texture, and softer carbonation. No weaknesses found and quite enjoyable.

Donkerbruin bier met rode gloed en crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Geur: weinig geur, licht fruitig, licht zoetig, en ietwat snoeperig. Smaak: licht zoet, wat zoethout, granen, kandij. Volmondig, romig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: koffie, bitter, wat zoethout.
From bottle in Belgian ale glass. Pours black with light tan head and aroma of choc malt. Smooth and tasty with a nicely balanced bittersweet finish. Excellent brew.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of chocolate, light roast malts, nuts and coffee. Moderate sweet taste with light bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel feel. Nice.

355ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours dark brown with a large foamy tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate, light roasintess. Taste is light sweet, faint coffee, chocolate and light bitter. Very smooth and enjoyable beer.

Schwarz mit leichtem Rotstich im Glas, braune cremige Schaumkrone. Röstmalziger Antrunk, der Mittelteil schmeckt nach Kirschlikör Bier Mix gepaart mit angenehmer Säure. Zum Abschluss kommt eine gute Hopfenbittere durch.
Poured in pint glass; silky black color with a dark ruby red hue. Aroma/Taste: chocolate, roasted malts, oats and chestnuts. Very smooth on the palate.

Bottle. Black beer with large beige head. Aroma is coffee, roasty, chocolate. Taste is light to medium sweet and bitter, of slightly sour coffee, mild chocolate, nuts, burnt sugar, roasty, some roasted, bittersweet cocoa in the finish. Medium body and carbonation, silky, smooth texture. Very good oatmeal stout.

Bottle at the Rising Sun in Smithfield. A beautiful colour in the glass and a lovely long-lasting head that went right to the bottom. Toasty malts and a lovely smooth velvetiness in my mouth. However, for me anyway, there was a strong and quite overpowering sweetness. I am glad I had it, but it really didnt do it for me.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 Its not bad for what it is, but to me a bit one-dimensional and at that the flavor seems a little weak to me. More bod !
Klares dunkelbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, leicht süßlich, Röstaromen, etwas dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee, leicht würzig, trocken.
Dejlig blød oatmealstout med flot dyb mørk farve og cremefarvet skum. Noter af kaffe og malt. Lækker sag.

Szczerze? Smakuje jak Guinness, tylko kosztuje 6 razy więcej. Zapłaciłem 22 złote po jednodniowym namyśle. Żałuję :/
Jeśli wiemy jak smakuje Guinness (ja mówię o tym z puszki z azotem) to to jest to samo tylko delikatnie bardziej gorzkie i kwaśniejsze.
Rich dark brown/black color; Heavy creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, and some chocolate; Flavor of roasted malt, oats, caramel, nuts, and subtle fruit; Nicely balanced; I did enjoy this one.

0.355 l bottle from EDEKA Preller (Breckerfeld), best before August 2017. Clear, very dark red to black with a medium large, foamy, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish, malty and slightly roasty aroma of milk chocolate, hazelnut, some coffee and hints of dark ripe fruits. Sweetish-malty, medium roasty taste of dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, some hazelnut, vanilla and a touch of dark ripe fruits, followed by a short, medium roasty-bitter finish. Medium body, just minimally creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Simple but classic Oatmeal Stout, quite nice!
Spoko stout. Świetny i rześki aromat, fajny wygląd i przyjemny smak. Wyjątkowo pijalne.

Ah the renowned Samuel Smith Oatmeal Stout - this benchmark of the style pours a mildly translucent mohagony brown-black with a well proportioned khaki head, just looks like hearty beer. The aroma featured a cool sweet toffee and caramel maltiness, some roastiness but definitely is more of a sweet stout. The flavor had a mildly roasty chocolate malt base with some unique almost herbal accents, perhaps some subtle notes of red fruit, not exceptionally complex but just enough nuance to distinguish itself. The palate was slightly thinner than other oatmeal stouts, but still had the recognizable silky oatmeal texture. Finish was dark chocolate with a touch of sour cocoa bitterness. Overall quite enjoyable and finds a comfortable well-rounded flavor profile. A must-try stout!
Very good beer - first time I have has an oatmeal stout - would by it again
Weich röstiger, eher trockener Beginn. Leicht würzig, weiches Getreide. Kaum bitter, langer Nachhall, zunehmend süß. 10/9/10/10/11/10

Poured from a chilled 1 pint, 2.7 ounce (550 mL) dark brown glass bottle into a Samuel Smith labeled pint glass. Ahhh, like an ode to breakfast, this be.
Glad it was reintrod way back during the passed century. Whats to say but this indeed should be celebrated. 
Think Ill have another.

Mostly roasted bitterness to the smell light grainy fruity aroma. Deep mahogany slightly see through. Bright light smooth roasted malt bitterness. Thin body works with how light yet smooth the mellow roast is.

Pours a very dark brown, almost black clear beer with a medium sized not long lasting dense to creamy amber head. In the nose aroma of malt, cold coffee and some hints of spice, maybe cinnamon. Tastes malty sweet, bitter like dark chocolate, coffee, low to medium hop. Its not really sweet and not really bitter, its in a very good balance and the medium to low carbonation and the smooth, almost creamy texture makes this beer very drink- and enjoyable. On the other hand you could call it boring since it has no edges, but sometimes you want a round and uncomplicated beer. Lets say so, you can enjoy this beer with friends who are not used to strong or too complex tasting beer while still having a good one. If you do that, offer them also the Nut brown ale from Samuel Smith and later then the imperial Stout.

355 ml bottle
very dark, clear nearly black, with foamy, quickly disappearing brown head.
smells intensely of "Gletschereis" candy, sweet, caramel, molasses, light coffee.
taste is roasty, sweet, toasted brioche, and again the "Gletschereis" candy.
medium body, watery testure.

355 ml bottle. Pours a very dark clear red-brown to black with a quickly disappearing light brown head. Aroma of mildly roasted malt - caramel, coffee with milk, some herbal fruityish notes. Medium, soft body with a low carbonation, alight bitterness and in the beginning also a light sourness - a little watery. Taste of roasted malt, dark chocolate, some caramel and again some fruitish notes (apples).

Bottle. Black in colour (Dark Red against bright light). Malty; roasted malts, oatmeal, very milky chocolate, very coffee & cream, dark sugar, toffee, caramel. Nice malt/hop balance. Rich silky and very smooth. Soft mouthfeel. Sweet roast malty, medium dry, slightly salty. Long bittersweet roast finish. Very tasty! (2011-01-03)

I remember drinking this back in 2005/6, but never took any notes. So I repeat. 0.5 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with Vinja 666, Tanja, Davor and Goran. Dark brown, small off-white head. Light roasty aroma, wood, dry fruits. Faint sweet, light roasty. Medium body, soft carbonation, soft, light roasty finish. Very soft and balanced stout.

Bottle 0,33.
Dark brown, small sugary head. Aroma: toffee, caramel, roasted. Taste: sweet, roasted, caramel, bread.
pours into a dark body with a caramel head. aroma is a sweet tart smell. this is one of the smoothest oatmeal stouts ive had with a velvety texture that really puls together the beer.
sweet silky and smooth. very mild and easy to drink. kind of wanted something stronger, but I could definitely drink this all day. Very neat classical branding.
strong malty aroma. black in color with nice long lasting light brown head. taste is malty, strong notes of roasted barley, chocolate, and subtle coffee notes. medium body, finished smooth.
Bottle. Black in colour, creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, grain. In taste sweet, moderate roastiness, nice dark chocolate. Medium body, silky texture, light bitterness in finish.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, milky.
Appearance: black color and creamy head.
Taste: roasted dark malts, milky chocolate, coffee, smooth and rather semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, smooth roasted finish.
Overall: What a nice beer, rather sweet stout than oatmeal, but still, one should try this.
550ml bottle. Poured black, foamy long lasting tan head. The aroma was roasted malts, toasted grains, dark chocolate and ash. Taste was sweet, minerals, cocoa, cream.
Dark brown color with a short-lived tan head. Rich cocoa and dark fruit nose. Smooth and silky mouthfeel. Sweet cocoa, dark fruit at the middle and roasted subtlety at the finish.
深黑甜美的黃
Вкусное пиво, хороший аромат, красивы& цвет, мягкий вкус и приятно& послевк& Дата изготов& 30.09.2016. (Bottle 0,355/ 5,0%)

Bottle. Dark brown to mahogany color, fine creamy foam. Pleasant aroma: sweet and caramel, prunes, blue raisins, dried fruit, pie. Taste: creamy, caramel, dried fruit, a little smoke, pastries and a drop of cognac. Nice.
Bottle shared at the folks - pours black with a brown head. Sweet and medium roasted aroma and taste, cocoa, caramel, oats, some subtle burnt brown sugar, sweet and roasty into the finish.
Pours black with a tan head. Soft oaty sweetish malty. Taste is roasty sourish chocolate. Short roasty-acidic finish.
Black color. Large foam. Flavour is quite spicy and coffee and chocolate. Top beer. I drunk 4 of these straight!

12 oz bottle from Mollys Spirits. Black appearance with a lingering tan head and light lacing. Aroma of chocolate malt, roasted grain, light coffee and light caramel/toffee. Similar flavor, rich, dark and malty with a mild bittersweet finish. Medium to light body with a smooth, creamy feel. A classic.

Black with little brown head. Aroma is coffee, brown sugar, roast, lacto, maybe raisins, cedar wood. Some grainy structure in there... Taste is rich and deep, chocolatey bittersweetness, also coffee bitterness and a biting sourness from the carbonation. Finish is bitter coffee and roast, medium to full body. Due to the aggressive carbonation and some sourness this is not as smooth as it could be. Not bad.
Обычный овсяный стаут. Ничего примеча& Бывает и лучше. Наприме& Шекспир у Рог.

Black with big tan head. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted barley, sugar and molasses. Tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted barley, and dark fruit. Has a creamy, heavy body with low carbonation. Has a great mouth feel and bitter black licorice aftertaste.

Bottle 0. 55l. Dark red, brown color with medium brownish head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, raw brown sugar, bourbon. Flavour is gives feel of emptiness if it is compared with aroma but still with coffee, chocolate notes, maybe also soma tobacco notes. Medium body. Balanced, not too sweet. Overall: really good one. Nothing to complain about except, in my opinion, it is somewhat thin in body.

Tasted from bottle. Pours almost black with a thick light tan rocky head. Aroma of oats and cocoa. Taste is moderately sweet with a mild bitterness. Flavors of cocoa and chocolate milk. Very sessionable and great tasting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep black with coffee cream head. Sour notes on the nose. Smooth chocolatey notes with a sweet fruity bitter aftertaste. A deliciously drinkable stout.

Rated by BrewTom

Could have sworn I rated this before, guess not. Pours a deep brownish black from the bottle with bubbly tan brown head. Aroma and taste of dark roasted malts, hints of tobacco and earthy must, a bit of sweetness. Thick and smooth on the tongue, mild bitterness, a solid beer, but like all Sam Smiths, has that typical minerality from the well water.

Black colored, medium tan creamy head, nice lacing. Aroma is of malt, milky chocolate, light dark fruit, oat, roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet malt, chocolate and milk chocolate, bit coffee, some roasty notes, light dark fruity notes, oats, medium to light bitterness, light roasty acidity. coffee aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy-silky.
(bottle, Pivoteka Zagreb)

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is midnight black with a large tan head. The aroma is malt driven with some coffee thrown in. The taste is coffee, malt and some chocolate. A very good beer.

I bought this bottle at Drink of the world in Zürich. In my opinion, it is a really nice stout but it is a really light oatmealstout, easy to drink. The body is a lovely deep black color, white and brown foam. Firstly, the taste is really mineral due to the original water of this brewery with this stout, we really smell that point, roasted malt, small touch of coffee and chocolate, a bit watery, hop.
Aus der Flasche getrunken. Fast schwarz mit sehr stabilem Schaum. Leichte Röstnoten in der Nase. Herausfordernde subtile Sweetness im Abgang.
Velvety in texture. Black in colour. Lots of carbonation. Very enjoyable. Chocolatey.

Donker, bijna zwart...iets lichtdoorlatend onderin en vrij helder. Je kunt het koolzuur zien. Crèmekleurige foamy schuimkraag. 
Aroma: Geroosterde mouten, koffie, heel licht vanille en cacao. Iets scherp in de neus.
Smaak: Karamel, geroosterde mouten, chocolade, basterdsuiker, lichte koffie hint en zoete gerst en haver mouten. 
Een aardige bitter van de hops en donker gebrande mouten en iets prikkelend en scherp.
Body is medium, voldoende koolzuur voor een prikkeling en zacht mondgevoel. 
Afdronk is bitterzoet en iets droog.
Niet heel uitgesproken en makkelijk weg te drinken.
Prima easy Oatmeal Stout.

Very dark brown. Rich malty aroma with roasted barley and a bit of soy. Moderately full malty flavour, and a lightly sweet taste with a dry and bitter finish. Medium body, and a somewhat watery mouthfeel - what happened to the oats? Overall, a decent but disappointing oatmeal stout. Great aroma, but I find it lacking in taste and body, and it is far from the quality of Samuel Smiths chocolate and imperial stouts.

Opaque black, average off-white head is pretty dense and shows nice persistence and lacing. Aroma of light roasted malts, milk coffee and red fruits. Good enough intensity. Taste starts slightly on the sweet side with a balanced bittersweet and moderately dry finish: roasted malts, milk coffee, cola, red fruits. Medium body with low crispness, silky and delicate but still quite creamy mouthfeel. Very good

- schwarze Farbe mit grobporiger, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Kaffee und starken Röstmalzen
- die Carbonisierung ist mir eine Spur zu brausig
- der Antrunk wird durch die brausige Carbonisierung leider etwas zerrissen
- im Mittelteil kommen die malzigen Röstaromen unaufdringlich zum Vorschein 
- hier bringt sich auch noch eine gewisse Honigsüße ein
- enttäuschend ist allerdings der kurze Abgang, hier klingt einfach zu wenig 
 nach bzw. wird der Körper des Bieres gegen Ende zu schlank
Fazit: Gutes Oatmeal Stout, aber es gibt klar bessere

From 500ml bottle. Pours dark, almost black with latte coloured head dissipating to lacing. Aroma was a bit metallic and acidic. Bittersweet taste with oat and roasted flavour. Must admit to being a bit disappointed with this one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

35.5cl bottle at home from Only Good Beer, Budapest. Nose is roasted malt. Body is pitch black, head is big, beige, rocky, mostly lasting, good lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, mild roasted coffee. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessertish beer, simple, good one.

Out of the bottle, poured a very deep brown, with a pillowy tan, persistent head. I got notes of ground coffee, chocolate, wafer, sweet roasted malt, cola, and raisin. Palate was silky smooth with very little carbonation and a medium-dry finish. I enjoyed it.
Pours a dark brown with a decent tan head. Aromas of chocolate and roasted malts. Smooth and tasty drink, without too much bitterness.
Bottle from supermarket.Very good stout.Medium easy drink.Silky and sweet palate with medium dry end.Ale nose,not very intense,typical for this beer style.

Pours a dark brown, slightly hazy, with tall tan head. Dark fruit, coffee and cereal aromas. Nice underlying sweetness comes through after initial sharp toasted grain/hop bitterness of each sip. Mouthfeel is slick, and finishes the same. Dark malt bitterness persists with the finish.

Visual: Foil sealed cap. Pours super dark brown with a dissipating very small head, a half-sized island with thin ringed retention, steady tight streams.

Nose: sweet caramel, light roasted barley malt, a bit of bourbon booze. (lvl-5)-pungency

Attack: flat slick-crisp

Mid-palate: underlying light tangy-sour brightness, tingly CO2, (lvl-6-sweetness), raspberry, brown sugar, roasted barley, woodiness

Finish: lingering maltiness, cardboard, molasses barley exhale

Summary: Quite a bit of tangy fruitness in this one, counterbalanced with sweet roasted barley malt and a bit of bittersweetness at the end. Somewhat lacking in thickness/fullness as well as a creamy mouthfeel. Decent, but not remarkable.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours an opaque dark brown with a medium tan head. Roasted malt and oatmeal aroma, hint of caramel. Taste is roasted oatmeal, brown sugar, roast malt, sweet and a little bitter at once, smooth with a nice body.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2016 Pours dark reddish brown with small coffeeish head from bottle. Porridge, chocolate and sugar. Surprisingly dry and light body. More porridge, dark malt and some root beer. *edit: this individual was just past BBE which may contribute to wateriness

From 2011 notes.
550ml bottle served in pint glass

This is what an oatmeal stout should look like: nearly opaque with a frothy light brown head. 

S - more subtle than expected, given appearance. Floral, earthy and malty; toasted grain aromas dominate.

T - starts smooth and soft. with predominately malty flavor. Noticeable chocolate. A bit bitter at finish. This classic is good to the last drop.

M - smooth, full bodied, significant carbonation.
caramel, bread, hay, chocolate, coffee, roasty, dough, barnyard, butterscotch, vanilla, black, cloudy, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, full body, creamy, thick feel, fizzy,

Pours black with creamy tan head. Aroma of burnt malt and that distinctive, earthy English hop.. Flavor is roasted malt, hints of bitter dark chocolate and molasses, and of course that English hop flavor that takes me back to the mid 80s when fancy beer meant something from Europe. Smooth and creamy, and quite sweet. Love it.

Bottle, black beer, creamy almonds colored head. Aroma coffee, yeast, faint metal. Taste is chocolate, molasses, hint of coffee, faint metal. Palate is good for style, not too thick, carbonation subdued, and very soft and nitro-like. Overall, not as sweet as many oatmeal stouts, nice balance.
Beer almost black, abundant brown foam, predominant flavor of milk chocolate, is a typical sweet stout.

500ml bottle. Almost black colour with a huge tan head and nice lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and a bit of dark chocolate. Taste is lightly sweet, roasted malt and dark chocolate, some dark fruit. Dry and slightly bitter finish, aftertaste also bitter, but very well balanced overall. Very smooth mouthfeel almost creamy though a little on the thin side. Excellent stout.
A verry good taste, I really can not fell the taste of chocolate but it is noticeable the taste of burnt sugar remembering gently brown sugar. Good foam and good body.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, bread and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread and roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Manages to create a great chocolate-centered flavour that is really balanced. The dryness at the end soon takes over the start. Could have been more intense and complex, but is tasty nonetheless.
Bottle @ home, split two ways. Blackish pour with a tan head. Smooth, milky, cocoa powder, light licorice and some ash. Quite good!
Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is light, some old socks, caramel, crispy bread, acetone. Taste is creamy, dry, some fruits, toffee, fresh orange, malts. Good and easy.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Dark pour, enormous light brown head. Smells is faint but pretty nice..roasted and sweet. Taste is good, slightly bitter at the end, but its a good bitter. Very smooth, but a tad thin for a stout.  Aftertaste that follows a few seconds later is a stronger bitter...not quite as pleasant, actually bordering on unpleasant. Overall pretty good.  Id drink this one again.
Kicsi, de nagyon tartós hab, fekete szín. Kávés, kicsit konyakos illat. Pörkölt malátás, kávés ízvilág. Selymes, picikét édes és savanyú, némi vaníliával. Testes, mégis könnyed, jó összhanggú sör.

Pours jet black with big tan head. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted barley, sugar and molasses. Tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted barley, and dark fruit. Has a creamy, heavy body with low carbonation. Has a great mouth feel and bitter black licorice aftertaste.
Old ratingsweet stout that seems like it has been watered down. Brown sugar, chocolate, malts.just too thin and milk-toast.
Nice color, good foam that sets slowly. Lacks body, thin and watery palate. Almost no aftertaste.
Almost opaque, with an unusually silky texture and complex, medium-dry velvet palate. Bittersweet finish.
Ottima birra di grande gusto e qualitaa bravi otyimo lavoro co questa berra miaa

I am a 1-2 once per week beer drinker. I began drinking Guinness 28 years ago during my honeymoon in Ireland. If I am out at a restaurant, and Guinness is on tap, it is always my first choice. This Oatmeal Stout was good and reconfirmed that I like Stouts. It has a slight but noticeable sweet start, I guess from the oatmeal, which I enjoyed. But, it cost $4.79 for one pint bottle at the beer store and, for the price, and for overall taste, I still prefer Guinness.

*Old rating. Great intense dark brew. Not too sticky but great deep. Round, fresh, roasted. Chocolate, roasted oats, moderate bitter. Long dark roasted espresso-chocolate aftertaste on a fresh and drinkable body. Great!
almost black liquid with thick tan head. aroma of roasted malts. taste of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. light body, creamy, average carbonation,
33cl @ bottle. Aroma ottimo, bellaspetto. Predomina il dolce, molto beverina. Birra ottima.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a dark brown with a big fluffy tan head and plenty of lacing. Faint aroma of dark malts. Medium body, not very thick. Very smooth and creamy with a slightly malty taste. Flavors are not very prominent. OK, but pretty plain and unremarkable.

Originally rated on 8/5/08. My first try at an oatmeal stout, i like oatmeal, and stouts, it sounded like an intriguing combination. It had a black body with a thin tan head. aroma of roasted malts, and coffee. Flavor also had the roasted malt, coffee and brown sugar, not any oatmeal to speak of however. Mouthfeel was creamy and was very smooth, with a sweet aftertaste. I will definatley give this another try

Bottle 55cl / Botella 55cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, slightly smoky / Malta tostada, cafe, chocolate, ligeramente ahumado.
Pours deep black with persistent frothy beige head. Sweet nose, toasted malts, bread, light smoked. Taste is sweet, light bitter, sticky finish. Medium body, smooth palate. Balanced, nice stout.
En god smag af noget ala lakrids, har en let humlet smag, og en lettere røget eftersmag. En god øl der kan drikkes både til mad, men er faktisk også rigtig god alene.

Bottle, from Wittich web shop. Dark roasty aroma, not particularly defined, but nice. Beautiful dark brown color. Some oats on the tongue, but not so much actually. Good roast and quite a bit of content considering the ABV. Still quite light and easy. Some BA notes?

Very dark and with a eleganbt beige head of very little bubbles.

Aroma is a bit of a let down thogh, just the canonical roasted malts and coffe.
Given that, in the mouth is surprising instead.

Its a full-bodied beer that, with the aid of a medium carbonation, envelops the tongue with a very pleasant silky texture and flavours of roasted coffe, spices and caramel, with a nice smoky finish.

Very well balanced and easy to drink with big sips.

Roasted malts, coffee, creamy on the nose, no hop aroma. 

Very dark. Probably a 35-36. Light tan head dissipated quickly

Sweet roasty malts up front with bitterness balancing out the mid palate and finish. I get some hip bitterness but think most is from the coffee flavors from the roasting. 

Medium bodied, nicely carbonated 

Nice beer, well balanced. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 55cl. Poured into a shaker. Almost opaque deep ruby brown, tall frothy tan head, good retention, heavy lacing; aroma roasted malts, coffee, cocoa, dried dark fruits, hint of smoke; smooth taste, medium sweet and bitter, malty, milk chocolate, light licorice, smoky/meaty, with average duration, light bittersweet finish, spicy and chocolate notes; medium body, watery to oily texture, soft carbonation; smooth, well-balanced and pleasant.

Sort/brun Sweet Stout med flot tætskummende moccafarvet skumkrone på 2-3 cm. Rolig og ufiltreret. Toppen svinder til kant og overflade. 
Aromaen er sødligt præget af chokolade-noter, havregrød, ristet malt og lidt fugtig kælderaroma. Rigtig fin. 
Smagen er bittersød i en meget fin balance. Noter af chokolade og ristet malt. Middel bitter og lille sødme. Velsmagende.
Fin middel fyldig krop og rund blød mundfølelse. Middel karboneret og en næsten cremet konsistens. Afslutningen er bittersød og let syrlig samt kort. 
Overall: Der er simpelthen så pokkers meget god smag i disse beskedne 5,5 % ABV. Smagsmæssigt fås det vist ikke bedre, hvis alkoholprocenten ikke skal højere op. Dejligt bekendtskab.
550 ml, flaske, 5.5 % ABV, BB: 10/2015, købt i Barley Wine i CPH City. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smooth, silky, mild roast, light chocolate... easy drinking, well balanced, bitter sweet. Simple and delicious.

Un bel colore mogano con abbondante e pannosa schiuma nocciola. Al naso sentori di torrefatto, marsala, cioccolato al latte ed un iniziale sentore di solvente.
In bocca è un tappeto di seta, morbida e sinuosa con un toffee che si spalma sulla lingua in modo garbato. Il retrogusto è di caffè e muffin al cioccolato con delicate note balsamiche e legnose. Il finale è tendenzialmente dolce, ma con un buon equilibrio
Bottle into pint glass. Pours a jet black colour with tan head. Aroma is sweet with some roastiness. Taste is about the same with a silky mouth feel.

Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 06/01/2016. BBD: 05/2016
Color negro, aromas torrefactos, sabor cafe, cacao, cuerpo medio sedoso.

Piwo czarne, z obfitą pianą która utrzymuje się do samego końca. W zapachu kawa, gorzka czekolda, masło a nawet trochę wanilli - bogactwo aromatu. W smaku lekko alkoholowe i czuć lekko banan. Smak jest bardzo złożony. Piwo w piciu sprawia wrażenie gęstego, może to za sprawą użytych różnego rodzaju słodów zbożowych. Niewielka goryczka. Piwo bardzo pijalne. Super stout !

I love this beer! Im usually into wheat beers and lighter tasting types but this beer is my new favorite. Very malty, creamy and thick, great taste and feel like you are drinking a true thick beer. Smooth all the way through and only a tiny bit of bitterness at the end but nothing like a normal dark or bock. Of you like the smoothness, thickness, and non bitter taste of wheat beers this will be tour new favorite.

Pint glass bottle pour. Very dark brown with a frothy tan head that leaves nice lacing as it shrinks. Aroma is oats, barley, and coffee with cream. Flavor is mocha, oatmeal, and roasted barley. Creamy and somewhat dry. outstanding.
Bottle.Black colour with small beige head.Aroma is creamy and smooth with flavor of chocolate and coffee,oily texture and creamy sweet and smooth mouthfeels really nice by style.

A damn solid beer if ever there were one, Samuel Smiths never ceases to deliver the goods. There are no jutting edges to this beer, smooth and well rounded with a silky yet peppy mouthfeel. Milk chocolate, extremely subtle dark espresso, and a slight lactic twang paired with toasty brown bread. I could drink a Stout like this all day, any day. Fantastic.

Bottle to tulip. Pours black with tan froth head, good lacing. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, toffee, oatmeal, raisin. Taste of same with some black olive in finish. Molasses too although I did just eat a bunch of BBQ. Mouthfeel is mod syrupy with mod-heavy carb.

My gateway stout. Blackstrap molasses as well as chocolate. Pours nearly jet black with a tan head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat intensywny, śliwki w czekoladzie, lekka paloność. Kolor ciemnobrunatny, delikatne przebłyski pod światło. Piana beżowa, obfita, dość gęsta, krótkotrwała. Piwo pełne w smaku, na pierwszym planie palone słody, gorzka czekolada. W tle trochę kakao, śliwki. Przyjemny, lekki finisz z lekko paloną niską goryczką. Wysycenie niskie. Piwo bardzo dobre, gdyby goryczka była trochę wyższa, byłoby jeszcze lepiej.

Bottle. Above average carbonation. Rich and flavorful, belies relatively low ABV 5.0. Slightly sweet. Prominent caramel and toffee flavors. Very smooth, well finished, with no off-flavors. Very drinkable. Distinct toffee flavored finish.
Dark pour almost no head, smooth silky mouth. Plenty of flavor malty with fruit flavor, somewhat like raisins
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark opaque brown pour with a big frothy tan head, aroma has roast malt and dark chocolate, taste has chocolate, dark fruits, robust roast, bitter chocolate.

Black. Nose of light fruit, black olives, faintest of brown sugar and mild roast. Flavor is gentle roast with faint black olive and mild fruit. Lingering fruit, brown sugar and roast. All aspects su the and well layered.

Rated rom old notes. Full bodied and silky sweet. Aroma is malty with fruity undertones, although the fruit is less evident in the taste. Robust in body and rich in taste. Sweet, but not excessively so; well balanced and a personal favorite. No doubt full of healthy fiber. Best enjoyed warm - about 15c or low 60f

Bottle. Pours a dark mahogany color with a good tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit with bit of chocolate. Taste of roasted malt, dark fruit, oatmeal and trance of chocolate. Nice bitterness and a dry finish. Fully body, thick and creamy. Hard to beat a classic beer.

Big brownish frothy head with good retention. Clear mahogany colour. Aroma is ripe dark fruit (prune), chocolate, slightly spicy. Taste is dark fruit, chocolate, slightly milky with some diacetyl. Slightly sticky palate. It evolves more diacetyl as the time goes by.
on my top 10 list. Silky smooth, dark colors and mild flavor. Not too sweet like some in this class.

Great alternative to other stouts, I like this a lot for sure and while I was looking forward to a stout with more of an oat meal taste as was my assumption from the name, I found a great tasting stout made with oat meal yeast

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours out a very dark brown color with a frothy tan head. Sweet roasty aromas. Flavor is also sweet and malty. Butterscotch and caramel finish.

Damn good sweet Stout
Bottle. Pours dark ruby with nice tan head. Nose and taste is chocolate, dark fruit, coffee. Tastes a lot like a dubbel.

Bottle. Another one of those classic beers that pre-dates and lives on through the craft explosion. Dark black. Thick white head. Looks like a stout but that shouldnt be hard tomachieve. Smooth. Roastiness but not harsh and bitter, soft and mellow. Hint of a lactic flavour. Very nice indeed.
Black colour, small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, oats, berries, cocoa. Sweet lightly dry taste. Thin to medium body and average carbonation. Nice stout.

355 ml bottle. Bought in La mise en Biere in Lausanne. Dark british stout smell, with coffe, cereals, butter, soy, and that natural refreshing water smell. Dark color with a brown creamy head. Interesting taste, never tried an outmeal stout before, but the name seems pretty acurate, its a stout taste, but with least toasted flavour, could be named sweet, yes, but its a different more frutal flavor. Got some peach there, grapes, dark fruit, bread. Good taste and fantastic packaging.

Notas a avena y grano, en general muy maltosa. 

Color negro, carbonatacion y corona de espuma media, excelente retención, cuerpo redondo. 

En boca maltosa, notas a avena y ligera acidez.

Al paladar fácil de beber, cremosa, densa, aterciopelada, de largo final y muy bien equilibrada.

En general una excelente cerveza, que nunca deja de sorprender y que se disfruta completamente.

Smooth, almost "chocolatey". I like most of the Samuel Smith brews. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Negra, espuma bege, boa formação e média persistência. Aroma achocolatado, torrado, aveia, leve aroma de frutas vermelho escuras, leve café no início . No paladar o achocolatado fica ainda mais evidente, amargor torrado, seco. Corpo leve/médio, com média carbonatação. Aftertaste mais para café e torrado, de media/longa persistência, mantendo um leve dulçor. Otima stout !
Kurze Review von Untappd: Light but tasty Stout. Nuttin special but highly drinkable.

550ml bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Decent stout a suppose. Bought this to use in a recipe. Aroma is fairly subtle : roasted barley, nutty, earthy. Very dark brown with lacy tan head. Medium sweet, nutty taste. Fairy smooth texture. Lighter body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with a finger of bubbly light tan head. Aroma of oats, malt, a touch of aniseed. Taste is excellently balanced, oats, chocolate, roasted malt. It goes down smoothly, medium-bodied, easy drinking, has a creaminess with a dry finish. Great stuff.

Bottle at csakajo. Dark brown beer with a light brown head. Nose of nuts toffee and cocoa. The alcohol is dominant in the nose as well. Taste feels like cured meat at first, even though it isnt smoked beer. This taste remains dominant for me. Aftertaste is very nice nutty-chocolately, but at first it feels like raw meat. Not very special for me.

Bottle. BB Jun 16. Pours dark brown with a fast receding very light tan head. The aroma is really bready, really sweet. So is the flavour, which has this nice dry chocolate and cocoa character to it. The moutfeel is very soft and smooth, the carbonation mild, and body medium. Love the juicy berries note in the finish, mixing with the roast. Kinda like cranberries - as it warms, I start getting it in the aroma as well. Nothing exciting, just a very good beer.
chocolate, caramel, coffee, nuts, toast, brown, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Pours a dark brown from a bottle with a thin khaki head, little lacing. Aroma of molasses/cola, flavor similar. Not thin like other sweet stouts, which is usually my complaint of them. Well-balanced, not too bitter or too sweet--well-balanced enough so that you dont even notice. Good beer.
Bottle into pint glass. Black with tan head. Aromas of chocolate, cocoa. Tastes of chocolate, light roast and vanilla. Medium body with a dry finish.

Aromat: bardzo słaby, lekko owsiany. Wygląd: czarne z rubinowymi refleksami, piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, długo się utrzymuje, zostawia ślady na szkle. Smak: podobnie jak w aromacie mało się tu dzieje, trochę owsianych akcentów, kremowe, troszkę czekolady w posmaku. Jestem ogólnie bardzo zawiedziony.

Dark brown beer, big fluffy tan head. Nose is a smooth mix of mild chocolate, malt, roasty notes. Flavor is coffee and cocoa dust, mild sweetness and roast. Dry finish with slightly bitter roastiness. Nicely balanced, very smooth and drinkable.
Nice and roasty with a fine bitter finish. Delicious nose with some licorice Lacking in body a bit but the oatmeal helps. Solid.
Bottiglia. Colore nero, schiuma compatta. Non sono amante delle stout e questa birra non mi aiuta. Nel sapore é molto leggera. Sento poco la presenza dei malti tostati e il loro retrogusto amaro.
Taste of oats and sam smith base stout. Very smooth due to the low ABV. Color is black with a tan head. One of my favorite beers.
This is a VERY good oatmeal stout. Very rich and smooth. Notes of coffee and chocolate. Smooth on the palate with a creamy texture. Dark opaque color with a caramel head. Awesome.

355ml bottle. Very dark brown color. Small size, brown head, stays. Mild brownies, oatmeal, chocolate, bit rusty notes in aroma. Strong oatmeal, mild chocolate, sweet taste. Oatmeal everywhere. Oatmeal does what it supposed to do. Mellows and smoothens the beer. Very oatmealy brew.

Bottle. With that label it looks like a medicine bottle from late 19th century. Dark body, medium to small beige head. Rich milky and roasty aroma with some light coffee and notes of oat cookies. Sweet roasty taste, very smooth and pleasant. Doesnt ever become overbearing, almost infinitely drinkable. A classic oatmeal stout and for a good reason.

Opaque black, brownish head.
Smells like chocolate and dates.
Off-dry, mild to medium bitterness, full creamy body some sourness.
Tastes like milk chocolate, wet stone, dried fruit, and herbal hops.
Very good. Samuel Smith makes really enjoyable and drinkable medium abv dark beers.

0,355L bottle. Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is roast, fruits, malt, sour notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, raisins, apples, dark chocolate. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: very enjoyable brew. For some odd reason English can make nice flavorful lower ABV brews and others (mostly) cant.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours a dark brown to black color with a big and fluffy tan head and lacing. The aroma is dried fruit, licorice, coffee, and burnt sugar. The taste is dried fruit and licorice up front with sugary milk, roasted coffee, and some chocolate on the back end. The palate is nice and creamy with just the right amount of carbonation. This is a classic.

From the bottle. Pours dark pitch black with firm beige head. Nose of sweet raisin like a Dessert wine. Sim alcohol taste is sweet and not much bitterness. Dryed fruit and rosted malts. Sweet liqurice aftertaste. Awesome oatmeal stout...
Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, some soy sauce. Taste is smooth but slightly tart too... 60% Cocoa? Solid.

Black little rimming beige head; aroma is malty sweetish molasses touch of licorice; flava is rich malty slightly toasty tangy with a hint of wood ; feels medium silky slight fizz; finished malty tangy

From 0,33l bottle, Pours dark brown to black liquid, big frothy tan to brown head, Aroma: sweet, milk, malty, musli, milk chocolate, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, milk chocolate, malty, musli, coffee with milk, Palate: medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long coffee milk finish. Delicious, enjoyed.

From bottle. Pours black with a big light beige head. Aroma is sweet and molasses. Taste has a gentle sweetness, roasted and hints of chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel, full body. Nice carbonation. Dry finish.
Bottle from Plonk. Sweet, very mild roastiness, more astringency, a hint of choc, fairly dry finish. Medium carb, full mouthfeel. Great oatmeal stout - lovely.

I will keep it short on this one and say this is a mighty fine beer to enjoy carefully, or just to drink. Are there more complex oatmeal stouts? Sure. Aroma is weak and its not the perfect pour (from bottle) but its smooth, tastes great, and needs no excuses.

Deep reddish brown body with a light brown a foamy head. Aroma is sweet with notes of chocolate and oats. Taste is sweet and smooth with oats and a slight hint of chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

550ml bottle into pint glass (room temperature). Nose is milk chocolate with slight acid. Not quite opague, slightly ruby. Small white head. Full-bodied with creamy texture. Theres a beautiful sweet note in the taste that is always English to me. Finish is a low-level lingering chocolate with a touch of lactic acid. . Great beer from a great brewery.

Bottle from Drinkshop. Aroma dried fruits, roasted, light solventy alcohols. Very dark brown colour, head disappearing pretty quickly. Taste again shows dried fruits, dark roasted malt character. That is about all. The beer is rather dry, almost no sweetness to speak of. Rather easily drinkable. Quite well balanced, good beer.
Schwarz bis rot. Seicht röstiger Geruch. Im Geschmack leicht säuerlich, recht trocken, sehr röstig. Im Abgang leicht hopfig.

This is a great stout to enjoy in the summertime. It's not too filling and very well balanced.

Utrolig lækker, og ikke alt for tung stout. Vigtigt at øllen ikke er alt for kold, da man som ved de fleste stouts ikke får den fulde smags og duftoplevelse.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Opaque reddish-black beer with a head which pours thick but soon dissipates. Light, chocolatey malt aroma. Flavour is chocolate, malt and fruit. Its smooth, rich and almost creamy. Its a fairly standard stout but its a brilliant example of the type. Lovely.

500ml bottle. Deep black with a thick off white head. Creamy aroma, with some dried fruit coming through. Taste is soft and creamy, sweet with hints of dark chocolate and coffee. Not spectacular, but a very nice stout
Pitch black. Very nicely balanced, creamy stout. Easy drinking. Could do with a little more umpf.
Bottle. Black colour, small brown head that does not stay long. Aroma is dark chocolate, some hops, liquorice, candi sugar, a bit of ash. Light bitterness. Very smooth, a real pleasure to drink.

Aroma is molasses, fig, oats, dark sugar, chocolate, vanilla and minerals. Taste is rich roasty malts, deep and pleasant. Some caramel and chocolate her. Balanced well with light hops and pleasant mineral ground water. Appearance is black with a thin beige head that retains pretty well. Not overly thick mouthfeel but nice overall.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, wysoka, oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Średnio dosyć intensywny. Zbożowy, łagodny. Nuty czekoladowo-mleczne. W tle delikatna paloność.
SMAK: Bardzo pijalne. Słodowe (czekolada, karmel, kawa). Delikatna paloność i słodycz laktozowa.

Aroma: sweet roasted malts.
Taste: moderate sweeteness, low sourness.
Flavour: coffee, roasted malts, fresh peas.
Light hops in the aftertaste.

Very pleasant rich, full bodied and fresh.

Bottle, 0.55l. Pours opaque dark brown with thick soapy brown head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of grass, mild roasted malt, chocolate and light smoke. Taste starts with light sweet licorice and cereals, follows by sweet roasted malt and grass, mouthfeel is rather dry, while finish is mild bitter. Medium body, creamy texture and soft carbonation in palate. This is a true fathers support to lactating mothers...
Another great stout from Samuel Smith, good body great taste, cant go wrond

CHEERIOS GOVNER!!! ANOTHER GRATE ENGLAND HISTORYCAL STYLE IS COOL FOR LEARNING THE DIFFRENT STYLES AND CONOSOERS. THIS STOUT IS VERY DARK AND STRONG. SO BE CAREFULL!!! Pours a jet black with a foamy tan head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, oats, and some roast. Flavor is caramel, chocolate, and a toasty finish. A little sweet. Quite good.
Bottle, pours black with a beige head. Aroma: roast, dark fruit, ash. Taste: chocolate, roast, oatmeal, dark fruit. Medium sweet, moderate light bitter, slick texture, soft to average carbonation.

Bottle from Bayley & Sage Wimbledon. (£3.25). Quite good beer. Soft chocolate with a gentle sweetness. Samuel Smith Soft Stout.

Botella. Color negro opaco. 
No demasiada espuma pero mantiene una fina capa.
Magnífico aroma: frutos rojos, mermelada, chocolate blanco, vainilla...
En boca resulta bastante seca con notas a frutos rojos.

500ml bottle from Sam smiths pub in Lincoln. Black colour with a light brown head. Aroma is slightly sweet malts. Taste starts sweet with a roasted finish.

black, tan foam, bread, cereal, chocolate, coffee, roasty, licorice, vanilla, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish.Thoroughly enjoyed this. A standout in my book. Highly recommended!
poors a black color. smells of booze and roasted malt. tastes dry and roasted malt. decent mouthfeel

Black with beige foam. The smell has a lot of licorice and is a bit boozy in the nose. The taste is a little boozy as well. Sweet with surprisingly little coffee with a little more chocolate. Not too strong in alcohol content. Nice beer.

Nice black color with inch thick tan head and red highlight. Aroma is roasted malt, a bit sweet prunes. Taste is dry, roasty, a bit fruity. Silky mouthfeel. Overall quite nice, not too heavy, but the malts are extreme. Well-priced.

Negra opaca. Escasa espuma ocre. Fuerte aroma a madera, café y ligeramente a hierbabuena. Mucho cuerpo y textura cremosa, con carbonatacion media. Muy sabrosa, mezclando tabaco, caramelo, café.. Final entre dulce y amargo. Excelente.

Pours nice and black with dense tan head. The mouth feel is awesome, creamy and viscous. But the flavour is overpowered by the malt. Just too much to let and other flavours come through.
