0.55l bottle. Very dark brown color with tanned head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted barley, caramel and oats. Taste is medium sweet with caramel and chocolate character. Medium body, silky texture and soft carbonation. Overall its great beer.

APPEARANCE - perfectly black, brown head. Perfect oatmeal stout color.
NOSE  sweet maltiness.
FLAVOR  classic! Oatmeal stout at its finest (yes, Ive read the label, but I believe it for sure).

Bottle shared with Sarah at the Angel in Tottenham court rd. Dark mahogany brown with reddy hues and a lasting frothy mid tan head. Dry roast, light sweetness, charcoal, choc, little coconut shavings. Flavour is earthy dry roast, coal, little sweetness, dried fruit, earthymess. Palate is creamy, highish carbonation, semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Velvety on the tongue. Really good.
Taste of bottle at cbf15. Black color, brown head. Aroma has roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, sweet. Roasted taste, vanilla notes, bitter finish and some berries.
Medium firm brown mokka head, black colour with some brown glow, fruity dark fruits some sweet some coffee hints, medium carbonation medium bitter some liquorise coffee some dark fruits taste

Should be The Standard by Which All Others are Judged..... Oatmeal stouts, that is. But.... not really any kind of a consensus that I can see on this site? There is nothing at all wrong with this beer.... the reason I didnt rate it higher is b/c it could be amped up a lot & made much richer, except thats not what an English Gentlemans brewery would be doing, would it now?

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in Hami hill. Pours pitch black with a thin tan head. Body is medium with low carbonation. Are is subtle with sultanas, chocolate, coffee and roasted nuts. Taste is much the same although the subtly of flavours in the aroma has become more robust. Taste is sweet chocolate and mild vanilla with subtle roasted coffee beans. Finish is quite bitter and lingering. Such a great, simple, easy drinking stout

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do stycznia 2016. Ladna, powoli opadajaca, drobna, kremowa pianka, malo brudzaca szklo, przejrzyste, brazowe, dosc ciemne. W aromacie bogato - kawa, czekolada, troszke ciemnych owocow, karmelu i zboz, nieco palonosci (niewiele), jakies rodzynki, moze nawet lekka wanilia. w smaku jeszcze fajniej - poza wszystkim powyzszym jest tez nieco goryczki - takiej hmmm... a la bardzo gorzka czekolada. do tego niemalo slodyczy. Wszystko to bardzo ladnie razem skomponowane, tworzace gladka, mila w piciu calosc. niskie wysycenie. Klasa piwo. a przy tym nienarzucajace sie, "sesyjne" Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aroma: Fruits, nuts, oat, pretty sweet
Appearance: Black, light brown/beige head
Taste:Same as aroma, but with a bit less sweetness and a bit of bitterness as well as roasted malt
Palate: Refreshing for such a sweet beer

Frankly, I love sweet stouts and I love this beer.
Creamy and milky. Thick mouthfeel. Foamy tan head on a black pour from bottle. Oatmeal and milky - very enjoyable.

Deep brown, flashes of mahogany, very subtle tan head. Smells strongly of light, sweet vanilla and brown sugar. Light tobacco. Tastes of a slight earthy bitterness, quite sweet though remarkably balanced. Longer finish that dries out significantly. Very creamy, medium heavy body, very little alcohol. Excellent beer.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought from Bierhuis in Ossett. Stout with oatmeal flavour and rich texture.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2015 Butelka. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, piana średnia. Aromat czekoladowy i kawa,lekko drożdżowy, karmel. Smak czekolady, łagodne w piciu.Nagazowanie średnie. Goryczka łagodna, super piwo, super oatmeal stout.

I am suprised to see this is only 5%. It seems thicker and stronger than that. This was actually one of the first non-swill beers I started drinking, which got me looking into microbrews and expanding my knowledge of imports.....sampling new beers, learning about brewing, etc. Has a dark appearance with decent tan-mocha head. Tastes of malts and oats.......sweet and nutty. Could be one of the best Oatmeal Stouts out there.

Had a run in with my first American milk stout recently and found it too sweet and cloying, but Ive gotten back on that horse and tried this one from the same category, and Im much happier. This is a full flavored but somewhat thin bodied stout which is not noticeably sweet and has a mildly bitter finish. The oats do the trick here in a fine, subtle brew.

Pours black with a large light brown head which largely remains. Aroma is caramel and raisins. Taste is chocolate, hop bitterness and some malt sweetness. Medium bodied with a slightly abrupt finish. Bit thin but not bad.

Piwo jest ciemnobrunatne i bardzo nijakie w aromacie. Zamykając oczy nigdy nie domyśliłbym się, że mam do czynienia ze stout-em. Początkowo bardzo kojarzył się z lagerem, a jedyne co dało się wyczuć to drożdżowy, lekko przyprawowy zapach. Po chwili delikatnie ukazała się bardzo delikatna czekolada i jakby toffi, z lekkimi aromatami miodowymi.
W smaku piwo jest bardzo jednolite, lekko kwaśne - trochę zbożowej kawy, trochę czekolady i posmaki miodowe. Żaden ze składników nie wychodzi na pierwszy plan. Piwo jest bardzo gładkie w smaku, treściwe i lekko wysycone.

Aroma: roasty, chocolate, coffee, some soy sauce in the background
Taste: light bitter, light sweet, roasty, chocolate, floral, coffee
Smooth creamy body without being very heavy. Silky and velvet definitely fit. Sweet flavor with a milky quality to it. Very easy drinking and enjoyable. Solid beer.
Great taste, smooth & oatmeal. Drank as a nice cold bottle. Easy to drink. Go to oatmeal stout.

My favorite of the Sam Smith collection. Very good in a bottle which is the only way I could get it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet caramel, toffee, and chocolate notes on the aroma. Black with deep red on the edges of the glass, roasted barley and sweet smooth oats slam on my palate, also slight "wild" funk. Maybe this is due to open fermentation, but adds a nice addition to the flavor of the beer. Overall a great beer.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 Black brown colour with almost no head. Taste of rasted dark chocolate, lactose, roasted malts, herbs. A little presence of smoke in aftertaste. Complex beer.

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się ładna beżowa piana, średnio trwała, pozostająca do końca w postaci obrączki. Barwa ciemno brązowa z rubinowymi refleksami, klarowna. W aromacie przyjemne nuty likieru czekoladowego, trufle, wanilia i delikatne espresso - przypomina to nieco "słabszego RISa". Smak świetny, czekoladowy, pralinowy, jest też kawa i rum. Odczucie w ustach średnio pełne, gładkie, wysycenie średnie do niskiego, podkreślające szlachetność trunku a jednocześnie podwyższając pijalność. Goryczka kawowo-palona, króciutka, idealna. 
Udany porter, skojarzenie z niskoalkoholowym RISem jak najbardziej na miejscu. Piwo jest bardzo pijalne, aksamitne, słodycz delikatna, nie zaklejająca, dobrze zbalansowana goryczką i likierowym posmakiem, ledwo wyczuwalna kwaśność od ciemnych słodów...
bottle poured into a pint glass..dark brown with an off-white head..aroma of roasted nuts,milk,coffee...dry,malty..not much to this.

Bottle: Midnight black with a rich, tan head that shows excellent retention, especially for a stout. Lasts till the end of the glass, leaving lots of lacing behind. Aroma of roasted malts, deep caramel, mild burnt toffee, espresso, milled oats, & a solid back-end of grains. Nice flavor with a sweeter cocoa essence that pops out. Good creaminess, almost milky without getting that overly sweet lactose feeling. Earthy toast, caramel, oatmeal, coffee beans, & bitter cacao nibs in the finish. Good amount of carbonation; thick & pretty creamy body. Really nice oatmeal stout.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 Thick, black fluid, with a creamy-brown head. Sweet aroma, banana and treacle, thick and chocolatey. By far the best stout Ive tried.

Bottle from Foods Plus, Plaistow NH. Aroma is a malty mix of bread dough and cocoa. Appears a clear dark-reddish brown--almost black/opaque. Frothy off-white head with fair staying power and lacing. One attribute this beer has that isnt often rated is its great SOUND--from the great pour to the crackling of the dissipating head. Taste is medium sweet with mild bitterness and hints of chocolate. Medium to full-bodied with creamy smooth feel, soft carbonation and awesome, long finish. There is much going on with this beer on many levels which makes it extremely enjoyable and deserving of its high rating.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2016 Kolor hebanowy, piana gęsta opada do grubego kożucha, oblepia szkło. W zapachu mleczna czekolada i trochę kawy. Smak łagodny, głównie mleczny i owsiany, ale mało słodki, krótko da się uchwycić nikłą czekoladową nutę, dość wysoka kwaśność. Nieco wodnisty, pozostawia coca-colowy posmak z lekka cierpkością. Trochę tu za mało pełni, głębi i charakteru.
smokey bacon, aroma. appear total black without any head. taste light bitter. average carbonation full bodied. short finish

1.10.2014. Colour like cola, almost no head. Sweet aroma with raisins, coffee and roasted malts. Taste has chocolate, some roasted malts, bitterness. Good low abv stout but could still benefit from heavier body. Excellent in its class.

Pours nearly opaque deep brown with amber-brown highlights, two fingers of pillowy tan head, good retention and lacing. (4/5) Nose is roasty malt coffee and chocolate, red berries and citrus. (7/10) Taste is moderate sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, creamy texture and lingering bitter finish. (4/5)

This would be a really good oatmeal stout were it not for the distinctly metallic edge to the flavour, which I guess is coming from the dissolved solids in the well water? Its still pretty good, mind you, but the metal flavour is a distinct, albeit minor, drawback. (15/20)

550 ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Looks: Deep blackish brown colour; Two finger head with crumpety beige foam which lasted for 2 minutes. Excellent sticky lacing with no carbonation.

Aroma: Rich, fragrant and sweet roasted malt, with strong cream, roasted coffee beans, caramel, toffee, sugar, burnt toast, dark chocolate, strong raisins, very light lemon and light grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet strongly-roasted malt, with strong metallic, strong roasted coffee beans, toffee, light soy sauce, caramel, moderate cream, strong roasted nuts, red fruits notes, molasses, yeast, strong lemon, strong bitter hops and grass.

Body: Medium body; Fairly thick and slightly creamy palate.

<i.Mouth Feel: Totally surprised by its superb roastyness  simple minded, but so damn strong and rich in coffee beans and toast and nutty taste its insanely likeable! And quite hard to believe its sweetness is really restrained, mostly thick molasses and with a touch of cherry like fruitness. The oatmeal gives out slight amount of thickness and bitterness. The metallic hard waterl well its pretty much offset by the roastyness so its bearable. Chocolate and toffee taste seems a little muted. Overall its still really nice!

Hoppiness: Light lemon and thin grass in nose, strong for both in taste. Bitterness from hops and oatmeal are high, pleasant enough for a lasting, strong astringent finish.

After taste: Quite dry. Very roasty, metallic and hoppy bitter to mouth.

Comments: I was expecting some strong smooth and rich oatmeal taste from this poster boy. Turns out its still pretty impressive, particularly the complex aroma and dominant roast coffee beans. Toasty, hoppy with a somewhat aloof feel to it. Highly enjoyable if only they dont use the metallic-as- hell well water. Cheers!
Bottle. Until now, my favorite oatmeal stout. Noseand taste opens with chocolate, a hint of vanilla and roasted malt. Full round mouthfeel and some sweet. Very enjoyable

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 35.5.cl bottle, deep brown color with creamy head, roasted and coffee aroma, in mouth is really smooth, creamy, sweet, without carbonation, and full, but, i personally dont like the aftertaste, dry with lightly hopped notes...
Generally i like stout beer, but I have drunk some better stout
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2015 Deep brown pour with aroma of roast and chocolate. Sweet and soft on the palate. Very good representation of the style. If this were the only stout, Id be a happy guy!
Old rating. Chocolate malts, coffee and cream on the nose. More of the same on the palate. Rich and creamy mouthfeel and goes down smooth. One of my favorite British stouts.
Silky smooth and creamy with a nice slight bitterness on the back. Very enjoyable sweet stout.
This has always been one of my favorite brews in one of my favorite styles. A dark rich brown pour with a great malty aroma. Silky texture, smooth and satisfying. A great go to brew!
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is chocolate and coffee, toffee, taste is smooth, creamy, chocolate.
Sits quite nicely on the tongue. Malty flavor. Not overly strong alcohol presence. Very smooth start to a slightly bitter finish.

A dark color with a two finger tan head. Aroma is toasted malt, some chocolate and oatmeal. Taste is roasted malt and oatmeal. A would have like it even more if alcohol was not present. I might have had a bad bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barwa: ciemnobrunatna, klarowna.
Piana: obfita, beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość trwała.
Zapach: dominują aromaty palonych słodów, gorzka czekolada, kawa, wyczuwalne również melanoidyny, nuty przypieczonego ciasta, w tle suszona śliwka oraz delikatna wędzonka. 
Smak: ogólnie dość smukłe, dominują ciemne i palone słody, na pierwszym planie melanoidyny, na drugim delikatna kawa, palona goryczka oraz delikatna kwaskowość od palonych słodów. 
Wysycenie: średnie.
Uwagi: piwo bardziej pasuje na porter, zdecydowanie brakuje paloności.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Bottle. Pours a black colour with a thick mocha head. Aroma of roasted malts, milk chocolate, oatmeal, slight dark fruits and some roasted nuts. Taste of roasted malt, oatmeal, milk chocolate, some caramel and subtle dark fruits. Full bodied and a smooth texture. A bittersweet, chocolatey, roasted malt bitterness in the finish. A really nice, full flavoured and rich stout. An amazing oatmeal stout.

Like it, like it a lot. Great color and taste. Not hoppy. Has a great feel on the tongue, very filling but not that heavy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 355 ml bottle. Appearance is black, opaque. Aroma is roasted black malt, pressed coffee. Bitter chocolate. Taste is chocolate malts, roasted coffee. Palate is moderate carbonization. I wanted to like it more but I rated what I felt.

Pours dark with some bloody reflections and beige medium head. Fine lacing. At first, unusual but pleasant aroma of yeasts and fresh bread, then, while the drink heats up, milked chocolate, toffee, lightly roasted scents . In taste it goes through light sweetness into sweet & slightly bitter finish. A light and nice salty note appears somewhere in the middle (or maybe it is that silky feel?). Medium bodied. I really would call it silky instead of creamy, a very pleasant mouthfeel. Medium-bodied. Smooth and enjoyable.Overall, it tastes very nutritional like a good meal. Oatmeal :)
One of the classics. Use to be the only good beer you could find back when petes wicked ale was around.

Bottle from vino but first tasted back in Philly in 2001. Dark dark brown, beige head. Chocolate and coffee nose, fruity. I've always found it a little over carbonated, but really balanced bitterness. Classic.

First sampled in 1982. Pours a nearly opaque clear dark brown/garnet with a huge light tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and a pleasant sourness. Taste is sweet dark roasted malt, blackstrap molasses, coffee, grain and a mild bitterness brought on by the roasting. A classic.

(Samuel Smiths Oatmeal Stout) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 5%
Pours an almost totally black beer, with a tall and thick light beige head on top. Very good foam retention, heavy lacing left behind as it collapses.
Nice aroma, red stewed fruits, dark fruits too, prunes.
Great taste with chocolate and plenty of it, raisins, sweet caramel and red fruits, light roasted malts on the finish.
Medium body, carbonation a bit low but it fits quite well, slightly dry palate.
Very good.
Poured a nice black..aroma was light..hinted of chocolate covered raisins and toasted oats..taste was on par with the aroma..very nice sweet stout.

Aroma: Raisins, dates, sweet rolls, vanilla, caramel, cocoa, toffee, oats, yeast, cinnamon, char, malt. 
Appearance: Pours pitch black. Thick, creamy, coffee colored, two finger head that disappeared evenly. 
Taste: Raisins, dates, sweet rolls, cocoa. Roasted, fruity, oatmealy. Smokey. Slightest bit of alcohol. Medium body with light carbonation. Sweet finish. Complex. 
Palate: Sweet, silky, smooth. 
Overall: I poured this 550 mL bottle into a glass in which I like to drink beer. Too sweet to be a desert beer, unless you were eating a unsweetened chocolate cake. Would go really well with something salty. Not a beer I would drink often. RateBeer member Mep3222 summed it well, "Not as sweet as some milk stouts, but has that smoothness. And this one is just very balanced and all around good." #respectbeerbrethren

Pours a very dark, almost black with some ruby and a small creamy tan head. The aroma is very sweet, slight oak. The taste is oatmeal, some spices, oaky, roasted malts, and a burnt caramel aftertaste.
Dark brown.creamy light brown head. Delicious complex malty. Not overly roasted or burnt which I like. Top notch.
Geruch ist reichhaltig, süß, schokoladig, malzig. Der Geschmack ist super: sehr rund und ausgewogen mit viel Bitterschokolade und etwas Kaffee. Hafer schmeckt man nur wenig raus.
Sweet, chocolatey, smooth malt. Really rich and velvety. Milky, creamy. Super good, great dessert beer.

0.55 bottle. Very dark brown color and a medium, tanned head leaving a nice lacing. Aroma of malts, wet bread, some semi-sweet rolls with crust, dough, and delicate but sweet yeasts. Taste is delicate, sweet, malty, oats, sweet rolls again. Full body, creamy texture, and almost flat carbonation. Finish introduces some roast and a hint of fruits. Overall the beer is not bad but I certainly do not see why it would deserve such high an average score.
Hardly any aroma. Black in color with white frothy head. Slight smokey taste in the finish. Excellent tasting beer.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, nuts, coffee. Taste is sweet, lightly bitter, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, bit fruity.

Poured into a tumbler in late 2013.

A: 3 finger head. Motor oil. It looks beautiful!

S: Absolutely delicious smell! Chocolate, caramel. Oat sweetness.

T: Milk chocolate. Oatmeal. Balanced. Not too sweet. Raisin when warm.

M: Creamy smooth, velvety.

O: This is truly a world class beer. Its incredibly balanced. There is nothing that I would change about it.
Black with a khaki head that lasts for a while. Some aroma of chocolate and malt. Malty sweetness chocolate and licorice flavors. Medium mouth feel. Overall nice sweet stout.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Dark roasted malt aromas. Dark roasts malts dominate with hunts of licorice. Smooth and creamy from the oatmeal. Good body with a decent mouthfeel. Feels bigger than a 5%er.

Color is dark black, no light getting through. Has a creamy light brown head, very little lacing. Aroma is chocolate malts, sweet, sugary, some molasses and a hint of licorice. Taste is creamy, sweet caramel, chocolate and a tiny bit of bitterness on the back. Subtle but big. Mouth feel is excellent. One of the best readily available oatmeal stouts around.

550 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark brownish black with lasting dark tan head and ample lacing. Aroma is overall sweet: roasted malt, oats, caramel and toffee. Flavor is same, with oat sweetness balancing the roast character. Thin to medium bodied, moderate carbonation, sweet malty finish.

Bottle from pack; Christmas gift.

A: Pure black with a foamy creme head.

N: Substantial cocoa and char. Biscuit, licorice, minerality, iron like its from artesian water, oatmeal, coffee.

T: Bittersweet and smokey. 

M: Creamy medium - light body, soft carbonation, no alcohol. 

O: This brings back so many memories of college and moving to Smiths from Guinness. Has that same iron - like acidity that is either pleasant or off-putting. I am in the former category.

Appears black but if held to light it has a ruby red hue. has thin tan half inch head that appears to stay for the duration. Dark chocolate aroma. Tastes of dark chocolate also with hints of toffee and dates. Sense a light fruity tartness also. Has sweet wet feel. Has a clean light fruity finish.

nose: toffee, oats, date. dark chocolate. its all there but quite reserved.

palate: now were talking! first theres that faintly acrid sam smith dirty water flavor for those of us used to super clean american beer. its like the difference between tapwater and distilled. not necessarily a bad thing, gives it a distinctness. body is on the lighter side. lovely oaty malty goodness enters thick on the tip of your tongue with great fizz and exits pretty complex and dry on the throat...what i can only describe as inhaling a hay field on a cold spring morning after rain while holding a hot mug of cocoa.

Roasted Taste Comes out well. Good smell, looks nice. A very nice beer all in all.
Had it from a bottle.

Pours dark brown with a thick tan head, heavy lacing. Aroma is a pleasant roasty malt. Medium bodied, soft and creamy, finishes slightly bitter. Taste is pleasing, roasted oats bringing a medium bitterness. Overall, a satisfying stout. I personally would like a stronger aroma and flavor nevertheless I rate favorably as it is quite satisfying.

Tan head resting over deep dark brown voluptuous body. Residual lacing all the way down the glass. Sweet aroma of molasses, caramel, and roasted malt with an earthy coffee scent. Taste is as complex as the nose. Chocolate and nutty coffee smoothed out with slight spicy bitterness. Well-balanced stout that leaves a silky mouthfeel.

A brown head over an opaque, pitch black body. Silky smooth and slightly oily mouth feel. Slightly bitter finish. Maybe a bit roasted but pretty much bland. Not offensive or pleasurable.  A single premium bottle disappointment.
Aromat winogronowo winny. Wyczuwalne żelazo. Barwa ciemnobrunatna, klarowne. Piana drobna, brązowa, długa. W smaku czekolada deserowa, trochę kawa i ponownie żelazo. Goryczka średnia.

Noire avec petite mousse marron claire, uniquement anneau persistant.
Aromatique sur le sucré, chocolat. Toastage relativement peu présent. Fruitée (fruits rouges je dirais). Légère sensation liquoreuse.
En bouche bien plus sucrée quattendu. Léger coté fumé. Petite amertume et sécheresse en fin de bouche. Houblonnage ressenti en fin de bouche. 
Lune des mieux notées dans ce style... décidément pas vraiment le mien, mais bonne bière.
Ein tiefschwarzes Bier mit Cappuccinoartigem Schaum. Aroma: Röstmalz, Tonkabohne, Karamell aber dennoch kein schweres Bier.

0,55 bottle consumed in Kosovo with huge thanks to Jacquie, my English friend. Pours black with brown reflexes, small ivory foamy head. Nose: roasted coffee beans, hidden fresh cheese. Mouth: cold frappe coffee, balanced and neutral bitterness. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas of fruit, caramelized bananas, chocolate, espresso. Pours dark with a nice dense lacing foam. Slick, roast, smooth, decent bitterness, caramel,

Pours black with a frothy, tan head that lingers. Aromas of roasty malt, chocolate, molasses and dates. Flavor is medium sweet with a fairly mild flavor up front that then blossoms into strong, chocolate and roasted malt flavors. Finishes with a long, dry, roasted malt bitterness. Medium-light body with a thinnish mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, although not complex, what it does it does exceptionally well.

Good oatmeal beer that feels like an after dinner cigar to some, a good finisher to others. Oatmeal stout is always fun. Cheers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
smokey bacon, aroma. appear total black without any head. taste light bitter. average carbonation full bodied. short finish

Fľaa. Tmavá čierna farba, bublinková, hnedá pena, celkom drala. Vôňa sladká, sladová, s jemnými tónmi kvetín. V chuti čokoláda, jemne praené slady, káva, kakao. Telo stredne plné, niia nasýtenosť. Veľmi zaujímavý stout. Som prekvapený.

0,355 l bottle, bought at Grebnhan´s, Bremen. Pours out BLACK with a big head. Berriefruits and coffee on the nose. Taste starts with more coffee, then it´s gonna be sweet berriefruits. Later shortly with coffee followed by the fruity sweetness. Little bit too sweet. Dry dark choco aftertaste. Not that heavy stuff.

deep dark brown colour, dense, creamy brown head; complex aroma of chocolate, dried fruits like plum and maybe raisin, hints of apple, oatmeal, minimal herbal notes and some coffee; taste of chocolate, mild roasted coffee, vanilla,dried fruits and some herbal liqueur notes; minimal sourness in the sweet aftertaste; excellent sweet stout
Dark pour with tan head. Slightly sweet aroma. Hints of coco, caramel, and molasses. Sweeter than expected but pleasant. Would buy again.

Pours dark brown with medium tan head out of bottle. Good aroma of oats, roasted cocoa with hint of vanilla. Good flavor but not as much body as expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle into pint glass. Damn fine stout. Not much head, you can pour it hard. As far as sweet stouts go I would consider this the standard, alongside left hand milk nitro. Highly recommend. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bottle. Pours black with a frothy, tan head that lingers. Aromas of roasty malt, chocolate, molasses and dates. Flavor is medium sweet with a fairly mild flavor up front that then blossoms into strong, chocolate and roasted malt flavors. Finishes with a long, dry, roasted malt bitterness. Medium-light body with a thinnish mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, although not complex, what it does it does exceptionally well. A delish stout!

550ml bottle - deep dark brown with a brown foamy head, like one would expect on a cappuccino. It hung around for an annoying amount of time meaning it was a while before I actually got to taste any beer. Excellent lacing too. Aroma of chocolate, roast malt and some grassy hop. Taste of chocolate, light roast malt, cocoa and a hint of grass. Medium bitterness, earthy finish. Smooth heavy body with low carbonation. To be honest didnt really think that much to it sadly.

Pours dark, tan head. Malty aroma with some sour notes, cherry I guess? Taste is a bit weak but has some sourness near the end as well. Some fruitiness. Watery mouthfeel, medium carbonation. I cant say I enjoyed this too much.

In bottiglia. Colore scuro, schiuma beige pannosa che va ad assottiliarsi rapidamente. Aroma di tostato, liquirizia, caffe, leggero lattosio. Al palato corpo medio leggero, gasatura bassa, bevuto scorrevole. Sentori dolci di cioccolato, cereale tostato, caffè e finale con nota di liquirizia che si accentua con lo scaldarsi della birra nel bicchiere. Birra rotonda e piacevole.

12 oz. bottle from Janes Beer Store. Pours a very dark, ruby brown with a dense tan head. Subtle aroma of dark malts, coffee, molasses and sherry. Rich, creamy taste gives way to a surprisingly semi-dry finish, like dark chocolate. Light to medium body and "silky texture". Kudos for an extremely smooth and easy drinking stout. These guys obviously know what they are doing.

Definitely one of my favorites from the wonderful selection from Samuel Smith's wonderful brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
550ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours black with a thin off white head. Aroma of chocolate. Medium bitter finish. Not as good as I remember it from before, maybe a little too cold.

This is easily one of the best oatmeal stouts I have had in some time. Silky smooth and not too dry, it finishes perfectly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Its black with brown head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts and toffee. Medium bitterness, lightly sour, lots of coffee in taste. Light body and soft carbonation. Very drinkable beer.

BOTTLE. Shared RW. Pours dark red/black, with a solid mocha head, great lacing. Burnt malts & coffee on the nose. Big creamy texture with dark fruits, burnt malt ending with a coffee bitterness.
Sourced Cape Cellars

Pours dark brown almost black ruby highlights fluffy tan head. Aroma is bitter chocolate, some coffee and some blackberry like esters. Flavor has lots of berry like fruit, some dark chocolate flavors. Balanced towards the sweet side however some ashy roast balances things out.

Bottle. Very dark, chestnut brown. Thin, sticky, tan head. Chocolate. Caramel. Some bonfire toffee. Heavy on the sweet. Light on the roast. Taste is dry, and a little bitter. A bit of sweet wriggles in. Palate is a little watery. Finishes dry, with a tang of tartness.
Piękna drobno pęcherzykowa piana, kolor czarny nieprzejrzysty.Aromat palony, słabo wyczuwalny. Smak kwaskowy, piwo aksamitne od płatków owsianych.Nisko wysycone. Bardzo dobre piwo :)

Pours almost pitch black with an outstanding head, lacing and retention. Subtle nose of dark fruit (plum, raisin) with light notes of roast and chocolate as it warms. Light bodied with little texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish. The flavor profile is laid back. It consists of a blend of light roast and chocolate with a distinct mineral note. If you look for it, you can find the oat character. The finish has a slight metallic twang to it. I suspect this bottle may be old, since what Im tasting is nothing like the other reviews here. If you dont bother to bottle date, then the reviewer cant take age into consideration.

Aroma of roasted malt and slight sweetness. Taste is a very smooth roasted malt with a bit of chocolate and a slight sweet, very smooth finish. Not as sweet as some milk stouts, but has that smoothness. And this one is just very balanced and all around good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

ASPETTO: nero impenetrabile. Schiuma fine e persistente, non molto abbondante.
AROMA: sentori chiari di cioccolato e un lieve liquoroso.
GUSTO: chiari sentori di cioccolato, accompagnati da sentori di caffè e da un leggero liquoriso. Lamaro è quasi assente per essere una stout. Retrogusto leggermente amarognolo, mediamente intenso e un po persistente, che stempera il dolce. Stout fresca e dissetante, estremamente equilibrata e pulita e che da discrete soddisfazioni.

550ml bottle. BB ?/15. Pours a very dark, ruby brown with a dense tan head which lasted the distance and left some lacing. Gentle aroma of dark malts, coffee, molasses and sherry. Creamy, sweet taste gives way to a semi-dry finish, reminiscent of dark chocolate. Light to medium body and "silky texture". A very pleasant, easy drinking drop.

Bottle pour black to opaque dark brown with thick tan head. Nose sweet fruit like holiday gum balls, molasses, light roast. Taste sweeter malt up front, again with the dark fruit. Only light chocolate, not much roast in the flavor. Moderate bitterness mid palate. Kind of thin for my preference in an oatmeal stout. I seem to remember this being better 20 years ago. Maybe it was my lack of experience, or maybe something has changed. Nothing off putting, but nothing spectacular either.

Buona atout, nero impenetrabile, con schiuma color caffellatte abbastanza persistente. Sentori di orzo, caffè e qualche nota fruttata. In bocca arriva il carico di tostato, qualche prugna dopo un po. Chiusura al cioccolato, per un sapore complesso. Retrogusto lievemente lattoso, con una leggerissima acidità. Birra buona e da compagnia, facilmente drincabile con un corpo medio scarno.
Bottle bier huis ossett. Black ok head. Aroma is choc slight roasted. Taste is roasted dark malts sweet choc some lactose decent bitter finish. Silky body. Good could do to be sweeter for me.

"still the benchmark as far as Oatmeal Stouts are concerned. Im glad SS no longer does the clear glass bottles...it was hit or miss whether or not your beer would be spoiled, but now its always great. Perfect nose, great smooth mouthfeel, if a little thin. Roasted everything, highly drinkable."

opaque with a tan head that doesnt dissipate too quickly but couldve hung around a tad longer. I like the hint of caramel aroma. Solidly medium sweet for an oatmeal stout with a light to medium hit of bitter in the middle that I think gives way back to the sweet on the finish. Its not the fullest bodied oatmeal stout but still delivers a creamy enough texture to live up to its heritage. Im glad those Tadcaster Yorkshiremen revived the style.
Oatmeal stout is amazing. One of sam smiths very best. Excellent aroma and has a nice hops associated with it.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 355ml bottle served in a tulip glass.
A: Pours a dark brown almost black color (amber tones against light) forming a medium and bubbled beige head. Medium retention and lots of lingering lacings left in the glass. A thin layer remains forever on the top
S: Great smell of dark chocolate, chocolate malts, brown sugar, oatmeal and roasted malts. Notes of brown bread and yeasts 
T: Slightly sweet and quite roasted upftont. Notes of dark chocolate, chocolate malts, brown sugar, oatmeal. Quite malty beer. Mild roasted bitter end
M: Medium creamy body. A bit molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Roasted aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. One of the best British beers Ive ever had
[ BA Review @ 5/24/2011 ]
Pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark fruit, and hops. Flavor is sweet but thin and watery , and very hoppy for a stout. No body or texture.

Bottle from Utah Liquor store park city. Pours coca-cola brown with a thin brown head. nice molasses notes on the nose. smooth mouthfeel which makes sense given the oatmeal. I dont get a ton of lactose but I do get a nice molasses note from the malt. finishes clean. Its a glorious beer.
Black / brown complexion with generous tan head. Aromas of sweet malts, molasses and wet grasses. Flavour is bitter but leaning to the sweet side. Velvet mf.

Botella de 35.5 cl en el lúpulo en octubre de 2012. color negro con sabores y aromas ligeros de maltas tostados con cacao y algo de café. Cuerpo medio con 5 vol. Buena en general aunque un poco falta de mayor densidad y sabores mas intensos.

Bottle from Bier-Deluxe.de. Very dark chestnut brown color with medium beige head. Promising aroma of roasted malt, raisins, prunes, coffee, dark chocolate. Weak taste of roasted malt, espresso, chocolate, prunes. Not bad, but not stellar.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, 
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
16 Oz. Bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours very dark with a solid light brown head which has some hang time. No odor detected. Creamy coffee taste with an earthy aftertaste. Great Beer!

Dunkel bis schwarz, schaumig. In der Nase röstig, leichte Kaffeenoten, Dörrobst, Kakao. Am Gaumen Kaffee, Kakao, Milchschokolade und dunkle Früchte. Cremig, ausfüllend, recht hoch karbonisiert für ein Stout. Gut.
Pours a very dark brown, with a brownish head. Full body, with a relatively light carbonation. Nose is chocolate, some dark coffee and hay. Taste is lots of coffee again, cocoa. Nice.

El aroma es ese olor a caramelo y un poco a chocolate, muy agradable.
Intenso aroma dulce a malta tostada, chocolate, frutos secos y especias.
Se aprecia la avena, la malta tostada y un amargor sutil, equilibrada con caramelo, pan tostado y frutos negros.

Bottle 055l @ home. Pours dark brown to black with solid dark beige head. Aroma is complex roasted malt, dark fruit, chocolate and hops. Flavor is sweet at the begining, reisins and plums, some roasted notes, chocolate and finish plesaently light bitter. Very well balanced, light body, light carbonation. Well done!

Samuel Smith does it right too often. This beer is no exception. Pours an almost opaque black, but with a subtle crimson transparency. The head is a good 2-3in thick with great cragginess. The aroma is powerful- coffee, raisin, other dried fruits, and some smoke in there as well. Mouthfeel for me is great, goes in sweet with a very slight bitterness at the end. The lacing as you diminish is great to see. This is a great after dinner instead of dessert or as a nightcap.

Bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a thick beige head. Aroma is chocolate, raisins and coffee. Taste is coffee, chocolate and sweet malts. Relatively high carbonation, medium bitterness and light mouthfeel.

- with thirst, Niklas

Classic oatmeal stout with creamy beige head and dark burgundy colour, blackish but still transparent. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, orange peel, raisins, smoked bacon, charcoal, caramel. Soft sweetish onset with the typical velvety mouthfeel of oats, light candi touch, bit smoky and meaty, with dry roasted bitterness in the end. Very appetizing stout.

Completely dark with some dark brown hue. Big tan head. Vanilla, chocolate and roasted malt aroma. Some sweetness, traces of sourness. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation. Watery finish. 
(Dobro Pivo Pri čurku 0,55l bottle)

Gorgeous chocolate aroma with a hint of caramel. Black colour with a subtle head. Smooth and sweet taste with a subtle aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with slight reddish hue and cinnamon colored foam. Nose of some chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is oatmeal (definitely present), chocolate, coffee. A very tasty beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Very dark liquid with average tan head. Medium to full body, light carbonation. Light sourness, medium sweetness. Sweet/bitter aftertaste. Aroma of hay, touch of roastiness and a hint of instant granulated coffee. Good one.

550mL bottle. Pours an opaque, stouty brown-black with a massive creamy mocha colored head with unparalleled retention and lacing. Nose is bakers chocolate, roasted barley, some coffee, and some of that famed Sam Smith butterscotchy goodness. Mouth is medium bodied, creamy, lots of cocoa, coffee beans. roasted barley, butterscotch, vanilla, raisins. I always like these on a crisp autumn (or frigid winter) evening, however, its the end of August and the heat and humidity have died down enough to make it feel like fall is almost here, so yeah. Strangely enough, I guess I never bothered rating this before. The was the first oatmeal stout that I ever had many years ago, and it is stil teh best as well -- or damn close to it.

Very dark brown color with reddish hue, average sized brownish head. Medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma of chocolate, dark fruits, outmeal, coffee. Medium sweet taste. Finish is slightly dry. Very good.
UPDATED: SEP 12, 2014 Simultaneously rich and light. Filled with gentle coffee, cocoa and roasted malt. Mildly bitter short finish.

Nearly opaque black-brown with a thick tan head. Smell is dark chocolate, licorice, molasses, oatmeal. Taste is slightly sweet at first, oatmeal and warm grain, becomes slightly dry; well-rounded, good body but surprisingly light. Aftertaste of cocoa, fruity hops. Tasty.

Transfer from BA review on 12-10-12-
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance  Pours a deep brown color with a big and thick tan colored head. The head has a nice level of retention, fading over ~ 5 min to give a decent level of lacing.

 Smell- The aroma is big of oats and chocolate. Mixed with these are some sweeter caramel and a light vanilla aroma. A light roasted malt and coffee aroma round out the remainder of the nose creating a sweet and roasty smell overall.

 Taste  The taste starts out with a smooth but dry oatmeal and roasty malt taste. A bitter chocolate flavor, that comes quickly after the initial taste, begins to get sweetened as the taste advances further. Flavors of caramel and some vanilla sweeten the brew quite a bit. The brew remains relatively sweet to the end where a light earthy hop joins the flavor. In the end a pleasant sweet oaty and lightly hopped chocolate flavor are left on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the creamier side for an only 5 % abv with a carbonation level that is just below average. Very nice for the stout style and letting all those great dark and malty flavors to be truly sensed by the tongue.

 Overall  A delicious stout that isnt overwhelming with alcohol. It has a wonderful oat and chocolate flavor with just the right balance of sweet and hop.

Bottle to 6 oz taster
Molasses, wheat, light cherry, chocolate, hay, sweetgrass, and malt.
Dark brown with a tinge of red and a long lasting 2 mm creamy and frothy tan head. Taste is malt, molasses, oatmeal, malt with a bit of black pepper.
Very nice malty caramel aroma. Jet black colour with nice head. Very light and hoppy up front with very big malt chocolate finish. Heavy body with medium carbonation.

Very dry and almost coffee-grainy rendition of an oatmeal stout, with mellow powder chocolate notes complementing a great balance of woody liquorice and spicy hops. Solid stuff given its abv.
Thin beige head. Milky. Caramel, chocolate, smoked, sweet, light bitterness. Enjoyable.

Malty and tart taste, bittersweet finish, surely nicely done, but not one of my favourites.

Bottle 33cl @2ndTSRG. A dark beer with medium head, nose is on chocolate and biscuits. Aroma is on caramel, chocolate, brown bread, burnt caramel, licorice, long toasted caramel aftertaste. Less creamy than expected.
Bottle . Pours black, with almost white, nice head. Some chocolate in aroma. Taste reminds of sweet black coffee with caramel sirup, served chill.

Pours a completely opaque black with a large mahogany head that sticks to the glass. Aroma notes includes rich milk chocolate, roasted malt, toffee, and coffee. Tasting notes roasted malt, include chocolate, toffee, mash, and a slight bitter finish. The palate is smooth and complex, a most excellent stout!
Great tasting sweet stout. Very silky texture and somewhat dry mouth feel. Chocolate & carmel color, is all and all a good drink.

Dark opaque black with tan lacing head. Chocolate aroma and flavor. A little coffee, more so as it warms. Pretty good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

550 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown almost black colour with a medium, long lasting brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and a hint of licorice. Sweet flavour of dark fruit, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee with a bittersweet finish. Medium body with a silky smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice sweet stout.
Although it is not my favorite style, the thickness and cereal palate since the first sip reminds me of its fine quality.

Pours a dark black with a tan head. Aroma is toasty but with a very odd sickly sweet smell that I can't put my finger on. It is a bit off putting. Taste is roast malt, hints of chocolate. Mouthfeel is smooth and silky.
Really earthy one with some milky moments, cereals and some malt. Drinkable, maybe a bit thick but also quite watery. Good one.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep black colour with steady low ehad and medium body. Aroma of torf and malt. Taste of torf, earth, leaves, woods, chocolate and mild coffee. Light dusty and roasty / smokey hints. Not a bad one.

Aromas of a scotch ale? Yeah I know that's weird, especially for a O.S. ... bb Nov 14 l13240. head retention around the rim, it has a high sweetness, low carbonation. Smooth but water mouth feel. It doesn't help being shipped from England to Australia, I'm drinking at room temp of 17 degrees. I'm not really satisfied. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Tömör és világos bézs színű habja rátelepszik a sötét főzetre, melyből intenzív, pörkölt gabonás illat árad némi vaníliás beütéssel. Ez a visszafogott, süteményes édesség ízében is megjelenik, és kiegészül egyfajta égetett cukros, karamellás jelleggel, mely mintegy ellensúlyként szolgál az erőteljes, stoutos karakterhez.
Pours a very nice dark brown with tan head. Oats, spice, roasted malt, and some chocolate on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a nice roasted character.

550 ml bottle to a tulip. Opaque black with 2 finger creamy tan head and a bit of lacing. Some sweet roasted maltiness and toffee notes. Excellent mouth feel, smooth, well balanced. The original modern oatmeal stout sets a high standard. Would like to try a coffee version... Like "Mother's milk"!!!

550ml bottle from Sendiks in Brookfield served at refrigerator temperature. Pours dark brown with reddish highlights and a bit of a foamy tan head. Aroma has caramel, molasses, some chocolate, licorice and a touch of smoke. Later after it warmed, the chocolate became more of a player, and the molasses less. Taste is sweet caramelly malts, bakers chocolate, some roast and some anise. Quite dry and actually light-ish, once it was closer to British temperature. Finishes sweetly with some roasty bitterness. Perhaps a bit thin. Solid offerning.

Pours one inch tan head. Very sweet alcohol smell. Coffee, roasty, toffee, all very smooth and sweet. Very slight bitterness on the back of the throat aftertaste. Sweetest stout I have tasted, and fills the belly well. Love it.

1 inch light brown head, dissipates slowly.
Light oatmeal scent with a hint of spice from yeast. Very light alcohol aroma.
Light-medium malt taste at onset. Light fizzy carbonation on tongue after drinking. Light bitterness from hops on aftertaste without taste. Extremely chill, very smooth, flavor, overall.
Flavour is a bit metallic, with oats, roast and some lactic acid providing a hint of undesirable sourness. Still decent, but nothing memorable.

Bottle, 550 ml. Pours very very dark ruby with more than a finger of creamy beige head. Thick lacing, and the head retains well. Aroma of roasted, cereal-y malts, and a big dark chocolate presence, along with a big hit of golden syrup and some smaller fruitier notes, specifically dark fruits and a small note of orange. Roasted malt base in the taste is sublter, and the cereal is more confined to the after taste, with chocolate, honey, dark fruits, spices and a slight prick of hoppy bitterness too. Body is a bit thinner and more watery than advertised yet the taste manages to retain its complexity, minimal carbonation helping in this regard. Very easy yet flavorful drinking, and rather warming for a 5%.

leuk antiek ogend etiket, schenkt zwart met fijne kaki kraag.
aroma is wat beperkt, diverse mouten met chocolade en lichte koffie.
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, melkchocolade, zacht en glad, emedium body, lage co2, zoetige afdronk, maar over het algemeen is het wel aan de te dunne kant.

(Bottle) Very dark, almost black with a tan head. Pleasant aroma - toffee, nuts, coffee, although all fairly subtle. Excellent palate, smooth with carbonation that is both velvety and has prickly brightness. Some residual stickiness. Great flavour, rich and quite complex with dark toffee sweetness rounded off with some hints of bitterness, more black coffee than hops, in the finish. Excellent beer.

Poured from bottle...pours black with thick tan creamy head and great lacing...malt barley oatmeal and hops... kinda sweet. caramel, roasty, vanilla, Great Palate.. Slight bitterness when swallowing then it clears.

Aroma: Roasty, cereal, vanilla, hazelnut
Appearance: Dark brown/black with garnet edges. Minimal tan head.
Taste: Roasty, salty, vanilla, slight sourness.
Palate: Full-bodied, creamy, medium-soft carbonation with a bitter, hot finish.
Overall: Like drinking velvet. Refined but slightly lacking in flavour.
Some chocolate, roasted malts vanilla and dark fruits on the nose. Sweet chocolate and toffee flavour. Not as big as other stouts but a nice beer.

This is an excellent oatmeal stout. Really smooth and smells like oatmeal. Pours almost black with a tan head. Way better than the rating. Ha at Mickey mantles in Oklahoma City 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from bottle...pours black with thick creamy head great lacing...first beer from this brewer...very tasty stout...better as it warms...malt barley oatmeal and hops...yum glad to enjoy!

BOTTLE 55CL.

Look: almost black with red highlights, beige creamy head.
Aroma: light roast, toast, soapy and fresh cut zucchini.
Taste: light roast balanced by that soap bubble/fresh zucchini-spiced sweetness, light hop bitterness, light acidity.

Black with caramel head. Nose is toasted oats and milk chocolate. Tastes medium sweet and light bitter and umami. Palate sticky. Carbonation is difficult to see but fairly lively. Finish light burn. Really very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 Bottle at oatmeal stouts tasting at Beer&Beyond. Pours opaque black with a nice tan foamy head. Aroma - roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, very soft and gentle. Sweet with chocolate, coffee, nuts and caramel flavors, nice earthy bitterness. Really feeling the oats that give more depth to the beer. Rather full bodied, silky smooth in the mouth. Fun and easy drinking beer. Very good.
Bottle from local Alko, Espoo. Originally rated 19082011. Colour is dark brown with small head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, chocolate and malts.
Bomber shared with friends. Poured into 7oz shakers. Silky, but not overly rich. Opaque color. Frothy white head. Chocolate and bittersweet at the end.

550ml bottle from the LCBO. Not quite opaque black, red tinges around the edges. Light tan healthy head. Smells like roasted malt, sweet cola, cherry and chocolate. Tastes like roasted malt, sweet vanilla. Quite tame all around. Not much of an aftertaste. I was expecting something a bit more substantial. Really made me realize how truly great St. Ambroise oatmeal stout is.

Bottle (50cl)@home. Head: nice beige foam. Colour: almost black. Aroma: nice roasted malt. Taste: delicate malt and medium bitter. Palate: medium-dry, lasting medium bittersweet body, tickling CO2. Overall: very nice.
Bottle from Eurospar, Thorsø. Pours dark brown/black with a tan head. Taste of roasted malts, brown sugar, hops, hint of chocolate. Creamy texture. Bittersweet finish.

Bottle pour. Dark brown - almost black - with frothy beige head. Nose is mostly smoked wood, with trace notes of barley and phenol. Some fruit creeps in on warming. Tastes of chalk and chocolate (more milk and dark), and minimal hints of plum. Maybe I purchased a dud bottle, but the complexity that is tied with this offering is missing from my pour. Watery mouthfeel. Straight forward, and well done for what it is, but too reserved to be remarkable.
Excellent on-style beer, bitterwsweet chocolates, hints of caramels, touch of roasty quality, nose has hints of fruit, great mouthfeel. Delicious beer.

Dissapointing. Aroma has a faint hint of chocolate and roasty and some caramel. Taste was mildly sweet vanilla, chocolate, light smoky but most of all overly inoffensive and boring and obviously made for a mainstream audience. At the end it even tasted a bit weird/unpleasant to me. Not a fan.

One of the best stouts Ive had, pours real dark black with some light that can only be seen in the edges. Loads of malts and chocolate off the nose on this one, super silky mouthfeel. Lots of chocolate and caramel malts

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance was an exceptionally dark brown colored body that yields a foamy brown three finger head that lasted for most of the beer. A beautiful spider web lacing clung to the sides of the glass. The body was too dark for any carbonation to be seen rising.
The smell had some chocolate up front and very strong. Once it warmed a bit some caramels and nuts came out.
The taste brought back the chocolate but it seemed it was more combined with the other flavors of caramel, nuts and some light toffee as well.
On the palate, it sat at/about a heavy with a dry finish and left nothing harsh on my tongue. This is not a sessionable beer despite the low ABV.
Overall, I thought this was a very good beer and am glad it was as heavy as it was. This would make an exceptional dessert beer and also go well in my wifes special chocolate cupcakes that she makes with stouts.
Almost black with some reddish glares, fine creamy beige head. Roasted malts aroma, some coffee, delicate oat touch in the mouth with toasted flavors and coffee again. Good, quite dry finish.
Very good. Sweeter. Not like the new high-tech stouts. Lower ABV 5.0 and very drinkable. A good choice when you want a full-bodied beer that wont knock you out. A classic
Bottle from blacker Hall farm. Quite disappointed, Sam Smith usually fairly high quality. malty aroma. Dark brown with a reasonable head. Slightly smoky flavour with some fruity bitterness.

I really enjoy this beer! Pours a nice dark brown and thick. Great stout taste. I highly recommend it if you are a stout fan

Revere Stryker dog!
Bottle, pours a deep brown with a tan head, sweet taste of chocolate, malt, and coffee, smooth and drinkable. Very nice beer.

Pours opaque black with a tan head. Lacing is quite thick and head retains fairly well. Aroma is roasted licorice, dark malt, and coffee. Flavor is very sweet in a roasty kind of way. I taste roasted malt and thats about all I can pinpoint. Its actually very, very smooth, sweet, and flavorful. Body is medium-full. Highly recommended.
chocolate, coffee, nuts, roasty, black, frothy, medium sweetness, medium body, creamy, flat,
Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, coffee, chocolate and oats. Taste is medium to high sweet leading to a moderate roasty finish. Sparkling mouth feel. Pretty good.

Bottiglia da 355 ml. Color ebano impenetrabile con schiuma densa di grana gine color nocciola di buona persistenza. Al naso sentori tostati e di liquirizia, al palato fave di cacao ijiziali che lasciano spazio ad un liquirizia molto forte con un finale secco.
Backlog. Bottle at The Green Lion Inn. One of the best classic-styled stouts ive ever had. Sam. Smith always delivers.

Poured into shaker glass from bottle. A black with a nice lasting coffee head and lace. Aroma is roasted malts, liquorice and toffee. A rich taste of liquorice and malts. Sweet with a bitter finish and warming for a 5%.

Nice, smooth, gentle, well balanced stout with some oatmeal, undertone of chocolate, roasted malts. Medium aroma of stout, oatmeal, mild chocolate. More flavor as it warms. Low carbonation. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 Flasche. - Schwarzbraun, hellbrauner Schaum. - In der Nase Espresso, leichte Note von Sherry. - Im Antrunk kräftigstes dunkles Röstmalz (Mokka) und gute Bitterschokolade, abgemildert durch süße, weiche Fruchtigkeit (Pflaumenmus) und leichte pikante Säure. Rosinen, Karamel. Mild rezent, sehr weich im Mund (Hafer!). - Nicht allzu starke aber deutliche erdige Hopfenbittere im Abgang. Mittelbitterer Nachtrunk, der nicht ganz mit dem wuchtigen Antrunk mithalten kann. - Sehr angenehmes, charaktervolles und süffiges Stout - so eine kleine Flasche trinkt sich weg wie nichts ...
Classic stout pretty much. Roasted malts on the nose with a tad of coffee as well. Very smooth, leaving pleasent longish aftertaste.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Pours brown with a small head, aroma of chocolate, honey, caramel, dried fruits and vanilla, flavor is bitter with chocolate, coffee, pretty dry, medium bodied

Pours a beautiful tan head and leaves lace all the way down the glass. Smell some roasted sweetness and a nutty aroma. Creamy mouth feel, very smooth. Has a unique taste and it does not have the amount of bitterness many stouts do. This is one of the best
roasty, chocolate, coffee, black, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation,

From bottle 2013
Pour- Pours dark brown with a creamy, pillowy, tan head.
Aroma- Caramel, bread, chocolate, roast malts, mild fruity smell
Taste- Toasted oat, hints of bitter chocolate, raisins, and a bitter dark roasted malt taste that was not present on the nose. Aftertaste is sweet oatmeal and caramel.
Palate- very creamy mouthyfeel with a nice roasted moderately bitter finish, and then a sweeter oatmeal (duh) aftertaste. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

I was very surprised by this beer. Its surprisingly light for a stout. I could drink this beer even if I was full after a meal. A good oatmeal stout I would drink again and again.

Thick creamy head. Pitch black appearance. Taste is very similar to a doppelbock, sweet taste, strong carbonation, soy sauce aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

The Oatmeal Stout pours a very dark reddish brown to almost black with a thick frothy tan head. The aroma is milk and cream. The flavor is milk, cream and caramel. Overall this is a nice brew. It is rich and creamy.
Really good stout. Perfect balance of chocolate and regular coffee. Just another great beer by Samuel Smith.

This app makes me type 75 characters in order to rate a beer so that I will remember it. I like this beer very much.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Schokolade. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig, angenehm cremig, schokoladig, erdig.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 550ml bottle, pours black with a decent head. Roasty oat malt, caramel, dried fruit, sweet chocolate. Body is silky smooth and the finish is balanced with sweet aftertaste. carbonation low. Nice beer.
Dark pour with very thick creamy head. Smells of oats and sweetness. A good toasty taste that isnt too bitter or sweet. Decent beer.

Bottle into a pint glass. Appearance is almost jet black, quite a lot of head initially- about three fingers- beige/mocha tight bubbles. Aroma- lots of roasted malt, sweet breadiness, sugar, oats. Taste- milky, creamy, rich, smooth, burnt toast, big roastiness, hints of coffee, bitterness. More sweetness as it warms. Excellently balanced and very tasty indeed.

Bottle poured into pint glass. Pours dark brown with a finger and a half of off white, pillowy head. Simple smell of chocolate and caramel. Tastes perfectly sweet, not too sweet. Roast coffee, chocolate, clean taste. It's full on the palate with low carbonation and it's velvety. This stout was pretty good but simple. Great lacing as well!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Samuel Smiths Oatmeal Stout sits supreme, right at the top of the stout lineup. Its not flashy. It does not pull you in with a garish label, absurd name or with the promise that its brewed with rattlesnake meat or cobra adrenaline. Hell the label hasnt been changed since God knows when. It does what it is supposed to do, it tells you who made it and what style it is. In fact this beer is brewed in Yorkshire with well water from a well they sunk in 1758 and chances are by the looks of this label it could be the only one they have ever used and I respect that. The stout pours an inky sweet black with massive head that remains stoic through its entire life in the glass. Aroma is of oatmeal (obviously), coffee, malts and barley. The flavor of each sip is complex, silky and textured. Key players on the pallet are roasted malts, oatmeal and subtle coffee hints. Thankfully this beer has a WIDE availability. If you have trouble locating this beer you should reconsider your surroundings. I could enjoy this beer in any environment from winter to summer and everywhere in between. This beer did it right. No frills no BS.

Poured from 355mL bottle. Dark brown/black with tan head. Mild coffee, chocolate aroma with oatmeal, vanilla, and sweet malt. Taste much the same, sweet finish followed by second roasted finish. Medium body. Silky into dry finish.

550ml bottle into an English pint. Pours a deep black with a light tan head. A bit of roasted coffee on the nose with caramel maltiness, and perhaps a hint of citrus? Smooth and bittersweet, with medium body. Mighty tasty.

Sortbrun, lille lysebrunt skum. Ristet aroma, kaffe, måske lidt vanille, senere hen sirup. Alkohol i smagen, mørke bær, en smule vinøs, men også skarp mod slutningen, brændt kaffe eller peber. Bitterhed i eftersmag.
UPDATED: AUG 10, 2014 Well-balanced bittersweet taste and silky smooth palate more than make up for an underwhelming nose. Coffee flavors creep in after an initial sweetness.

Bottle.

A- Coffee, cocoa, vanilla, oatmeal, roasty.

A- Black color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Coffee, chocolate, oatmeal, nutty, toffee, slightly malty, subtle bitterness.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- One of the top Oatmeal Stouts out there. Samuel Smith manages to make a very complex yet easy to drink stout that has great flavor and great aromas. Very well done.

Bottle @ Setka Pub, Poznań. Pours cloudy very dark brown with small tan head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel, and fruit, as well as booze in the long nose. Dark flavour of fruit, malt, hops, and caramel. Lingering, bitter aftertaste, with winey notes. OK, really nice, but a trifle too fruity.
Nice, nice oatmeal stout. Rich and grainy. Really delicious stout that isnt actually too expensive. Highly recommended.

500ml bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Slight malt aroma. Lots of great roast malt flavors with a silky finish. A really good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Firefly Tapas, Las Vegas. Pours a deep brown with small tan head. Nose is chocolate, toffee, coffee and vanilla. Sweet chocolate and toffee throughout. Medium slick mouth with soft carbonation. Excellent.

The taste is smokey with a sweet bitterness upfront with a dry, flavorless aftertaste. The body is medium despite a nearly black body. I like the bold taste even though it is somewhat one-dimensional. I also like the fact that there is no burnt, bitter aftertaste.

From a 550ml bottle. A little one-dimensional compared to most stouts Ive encountered, but certainly unique and tasty. It has a dark color with a tan head. Smells are of the darker variety; roasty and chocolately. The body is light with fairly low carbonation making it really easy to drink. I would definitely suggest having this at least once.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Pours black with a tan head. Smells of chocolate and roasted malts. The taste is well balanced and very smooth.

beautiful scent of roasty malts smells lively and dark pours all black with a perfect tan head flavour is no carb at all just a beautiful smooth creamy stout taste of roasted malts and very light mild hop and just all around great flavour

Oatmeal stout coi fiocchi, in cui le diverse sfaccettature del gusto si intrecciano ed esaltano a vicenda: cioccolato scuro, leggero caffé mocha, tocco intrigante dellavena, sfondo complessivamente dolce. Davvero piacevole!

Bottle at home. Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma of sweet roasted malts, dark chocolate, and coffee. Sweet malt taste, hints of chocolate, mocha, coffee, and caramel. Very nice, bit too drinkable maybe, but thats ok with only 5%.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Very dark, tan medium head, wonderful aroma, great flavor, good aftertaste, hint of chocolate and oats

(Bottle): Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, grains, slight milk chocolate. Very smooth, flavour is packed with roasted malt, dark chocolate, milky coffee, wood. Quite nice and very drinkable.

Aroma: caramel, toasted malts. Appearance: black, big brown creamy head.
Taste: medium sweet. Palate: light carbonation, sweetness continues, very light bitterness appearing, short to medium finish. Overall: amazing Sweet Stout - a joy to drink. Bottle from Kris Wines, London.
Sweet, malty aroma; with some prune, and a little roast. Molasses/sweet flavor--with more roasted barley than in the aroma. Subtle fruitiness, and maybe a little smoky.
Pours a deep ebony with a thin tan head. Very well balanced stout with a smooth finish.
Light but dark of course, sweet finish with bitter start. Mild overall flavor, very drinkable.
Robust beige head and deep dark color. Velvet palate with a lot of roasted notes. Chocolate in aroma. Bittersweet finish. Thats what I expect from an oatmeal stout.
12oz bottle. Pours a very dark brown. Smells grainy and a little chocolatey. A caramel taste with hints of dark chocolate. This is such a smooth beer and one of my favorites.
Pours opaque with a creamy, off white head. Taste is quite sweet but theres still stout in there.

550 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with full tan head. Aromas of oily wood, some dark cocoa powder, and stale black coffee. Maybe a bit of vinegar... Smooth in the mouth though. Flavors of creamy chocolate, vanilla, light nuts, and roasted malts.

Pours a dark brown, thin tan head, nice ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is of light roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Taste is a very balanced blend of oatmeal, roasted nut, chocolate and coffee in the finish. Medium carbonation. Light on the palate, nice and silky.
From a bottle. Dark black with a thin tan head, mild sweet chocolate flavours and aroma with coffee and caramel. Very good beer.

550 ml bottle. Pours opaque black with a small creamy tan head. Rich roasted malt aroma. The oats and earthy character come through upfront. Rich nutty cocoa-like notes, as well. Smooth bittersweet roasted malt with a touch of cocoa and sweet sherry. Very silky and wonderful texture on the palate. Slightly dry finish has complex notes of vanilla and malt vinegar. Arguably, one of the best Oatmeal Stouts in the world.
Bottle. Poured very dark brown with insane beige head and lace. Aroma of oat choc roast malt. Light carb med thick bod. Taste slight bitter sweet roasted malt oat.

A great beer at anytime and a staple in the Oatmeal Stout region. I always compare any oatmeal stouts to this one! Pours a perfectly balanced brown with equal aromas of oatmeal and the dark malts used to produce this smooth tasting stout.
Bottle, 550 ml from Kuća Piva, Zagreb. Nice stout, pours dark brown. Chocolate aroma, would drink it again.

It pours an opaque dark brown colour with a brownish beige mousse head. Aroma: Roasted malts and notes of coffee. Taste: Hoppy start with a smooth&creamy roasted malty finish. Good lacing and head retention. Medium carbonation.

Dark pour with an off white head which leaves some lacing. Aroma of dark fruit and sweet malts with some notes of coffee and chocolate. Taste is very smooth, balanced, and all around enjoyable... has some nice chocolate malt flavors with a silky finish from the oats.

dark brown pour with thin tan head, aroma is nothing special like most stouts maybe a slight metalic smell. 
first sip gives you strong taste of spices and roasted malts/oats. very bold flavour but extreamely well ballenced. surprisinly strong taste for having a low ABV. personally one of the best oatmeal stouts ive tried.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very thick crown, pretty sweet and light, hints to malt, licorice and toasted bread.

Pours a very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is mild with some roasted malt, sweet chocolate and oats. Taste is sweet chocolate initially (maybe a hint of dark fruit) with roasted malt notes and a nice semi bitter finish. Very smooth and well balanced. Excellent considering the low abv.

Pours deep black with thick lasting tan head. Mild deep roast aroma. Flavor of mild light syrup balanced by dark chocolate roastiness and a mild toasty malt. Medium to full body. Finishes fairly balanced leaving a mix of roast and sweet.

12oz bottle from Brewmasters compliments of Kent R. Black hue, zero visibility with mostly diminishing caramel head. No lacing. Coffee and dark fruit aroma once poured, as it warmed I picked up more of a chocolate aroma. The initial taste was a light bitter coffee with a sweetness I guess came from the dark fruit aroma? The finish was short chocolate, but near the bottom of the glass the sweetness came in strong. Dry on the palate. I thought this was a very refreashing stout.
Pours dark brown with a tan, foamy head. Characteristic chocolate, coffee, and malt flavors with a robust body. This was a very smooth and well priced stout.
Bottle. This is a really delicious oaty stout with a big full body and lots of roasted malt flavor
My favorite stout. Quite a bargain for such a delicious drink. Everything is balanced and enticing.
Pours a dark amber with a tan thick frothy head. Aroma is chocolate and malt. Taste is chocolate and some dark fruits. Very smooth easy drinking.
Lacks the complexity of modern stouts, but what flavors are there taste great. Semisweet chocolate and smooth coffee. Hints of brown sugar, oats and raisins. Medium bodied and pretty smooth.
This actually tasted much better then I expected. You get the typical smooth stout coffe and chocolate flavors. It goes down real easy.

550ml bottle at home. Black with a small beige head. Medium body with light to moderate carbonation. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Medium sweetness with some bitter notes. You cant miss the outmeal, furthermore dark fruits, caramel and some chocolate. A great full flavoured and well balanced stout.

Im not a fan of stouts in general but this Oatmeal stout is definitely a great brew. Poured into pint glass. Dark brown, licorice color with creamy head and some lacing. No discernible scent besides some malt. Taste was complex, maybe bitter coffee and a bit of metallic bitterness in the mouth. Very creamy and nice to drink. Still had that metallic after taste as it warmed in the glass but still a very nice stout.
Very good stout with rich coffee taste and some hay, roasted flavor. Complexity weakens after a while but this is a good beer.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2016 It pours dark brown with a creamy, light brown head. When head to the light, it is clear. It has a roasted aroma that is complimented with a mild coffee aroma. There are also hints of butter and vague hints of fruit. The roasted malt flavors are prominent with the coffee in the background. There are hints of butter in the flavors. There is moderate bitterness. The flavors of oats is a secondary flavor that comes forward as the beer warms. It has a medium creamy texture with moderate bitterness on the palate.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 That velvety smooth mouthfeel and creamy taste hook you from the first sip. The flavors reveal toasted grains, coffee, and hints of chocolate. Balanced and refreshing, this oatmeal stout is a monumental example of the style. Samuel Smith is undisputed at making this type of beer.
Well done stout with understated character thats smooth & mellow. Very soft with the chocolate malt coming through in the after taste.  Sessionable & perfectly done.

Black pour with a light tan head. Aromas of coffee, roasted malts, and notes of chocolate. Flavor is similar although a bit lighter than you might expect. Slightly bitter finish. Decent example of the style.

Poured to NB globe. 

A: Pours a dark, dark brown ale with two finger head which dissipates to leave solid sheet of tan foam. I can measure with precision where the head once reached based on the hardcore lacing left.

S: Dark fruits, oats, malts, almost a belgian yeast nose. Complex. As beer warms these are even more complex: lots of plum, raisin, malt, molasses, with hints of anise. Nice

T: Excellent! Very much oatmeal flavor, slight bitterness, deep roasty malts. So nice. Dont need to say much here, but that this is goddamn good.

M: Heavy, viscous, velvety, coats the mouth, enjoy the lasting effort by the beer to resonate. Again, excellent.

D: Very drinkable. Very nice. thick for a 5% ABV, but nonetheless a nightcap for many I suppose.

Serving type: bottle

02-23-2011

Bottle nice black color with off white head Aroma is dried plums roasted malts taste is roasted malts dried fruits and hints of coffee aftertaste is slightly sweet with roasted malts and slightly bitter mouthfeel is rich and oily nice One

Nice bold aroma of molasses, dark chocolate, and toffee. Ebony on the pour with a nice thick tan head with nice staying power. Semi-sweet is the first note. Nice roasted malt, sweet chocolate notes, with a nice mouth feel and hints of coffee. Nice balance of sweet, bitter and some dryness and medium body. Not sure how typical of the style this is, but this is my kind of stout. More character and sweetness than typical stout.
Bottle in Colppitts, Durham. Very dark body with a creamy biege head. Notes of chocolate, coffee and some red fruits too. Interesting bitter-sweet finish. Very nice.

A great oatmeal stout. Very smooth, very dark color and smells delicious, because it is. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
One of my favourite Oatmeal Stoats. Rich sweet taste and minimal head. Overall a good purchase and I highly recommend it. But of course, you know that.
Smooth, silky, creamy texture. Aroma and flavour are very well balanced in terms of bitterness and sweetness. Light hints of coffee, chocolate.
If you like a malty, sweet stout give this a try. For us however, just too sweet. Too much honey/molasses taste for us.
coffee, roasty, toast, herbs, leather, licorice, vanilla, soy sauce, black, brown, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, umami, slick feel, long finish,

Big dark stout pour w/ a huge tan frothy head. The aroma is a subtle blend of cocoa & roast. The taste is quite subdued but has just enough flavor to pull this off. The mouthfeel is what makes this beer. Its very well balanced, light on the tongue, & highly drinkable. Pretty darn good stuff!

550ml bottle at home. Pours dark, dark brown, near black but not quite with a thick, long-lasting tan head & nice lacing. Its a looker! Aromas are more subtle, but chocolate and treacle are there. Taste brings it all out in the open, treacle, liquorice, roasted coffee, dark chocolate. Medium body, creamy texture and a long finish. Really enjoyed this.
Obviously, this is a classic. Dark (dark brown/almost black), with a decent head. Taste of chocolate, oatmeal and coffee. Sweeter than an Irish style stout.

Zapach dość delikatny, słodowy, z nutą cukru, a nawet cukru trzcinowego i karmelu. Odrobinę czuć też chmiel. Piwo wygląda bardzo ładnie - ciemne, z delikatną, drobną, beżową pianą, która uciekła umiarkowanie szybko. W smaku - niemal perfekcyjne. Delikatnie słodkie, z goryczkowym finiszem - idealny balans. Trochę gęste i przyjemnie wysycone - tak, jak lubię. W Polsce nabyłem za 12 zł - wg mnie to dużo, ale naprawdę warto. Świetne piwo!
Poured from a 12OZ bottle and no head at all. The color is a very dark brown, I smell roasted malts, cooked brown sugar, some coffee and some caramel. I taste all of the same, very smooth and good.

Chocolatey aroma with hint of coffee and oats, really dark appearance with minimal head, hints of coffee on the tongue with a light chocolate finish, very easy finish with good strong taste very enjoyable drinking

Pours a dark mahogany with an effervescent head which dissipates quickly. Aroma is wonderful, fragrant burnt sugars with a spicy hop aroma as well. Body is a tad light for the style, but a lovely flavor of raisins and berries followed by a mild but insistent bitterness on the back side. One of the best.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
First oatmeal stout of the season pours deep & dark with a fluffy one finger cap. Taste is short & sweet; starts off silky & fades with a slight brown sugar burn.

Dark brown colour with medium beige head. Medium intensive aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Taste is moderately sweet, full of chocolate and coffee notes. Nice smooth texture. Finish is slightly dry. Low carbonation. Fantastic example of stout.

One of the most reviewed/rated beers on the internet (RB & BA): I hadnt had one since the mid 90s while working in Alaska and thought Id better treat myself to a bottle again.

This bottle (550ml) was bought at Beers of Europe and poured into an Abbot Ale glass tankard during November 13.

Deep, dark brown body, leaning towards black unless held to a light source: on top a large tanned blanket of foam.

Lots going on in the aroma (and taste): dark chocolate bar with fruit and nuts, coffee, liquorice and caramel notes appeared in the nose and mouth.

This is a well made, complex brew that excites the taste buds and nasal sences: I can see why its so popular.

The body is fairly smooth and slips down far too easily: a very nice beer in deed.
Very nice stout. Tatse is a nice semi-sweet matly oatmeal with a hint of chocolate. Nice bitter finish.
Bottle pours reddish black. Oatmeal, cocoa, caramel, roast. Very sweet, lightly bitter. Fully creamy body.

550 mL bottle. Pours opaque black with a thin off white cap. Cocoa, cooked oats, meaty roast aromas, cooked apples and a hint of malty bitterness. Mildly sweet with a slightly bitter finish and a touch of roast. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. A tasty stout.

An absolutely delicious drink on all fronts. The aroma is both rich and crisp. The taste is nutty and semi-sweet, but with a nice bitter stout finish. If youre looking for the perfect beer for a winter night by the fire, this is the f******* beer youre looking for right here.
355 ml. bottle. Pours almost black with a nice fluffy tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and dark fruit. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruit, chocolate, coffee, grain, and caramel. Excellent.

Deep copper to brown, clear. 
Chocolate aroma. 
Medium body, moderate flavor intensity, very smooth texture, long palate. 
Perfect bittersweet-sour balance, 
Chocolate, 
Not very intense, but well balanced and elegant.

An excellent stout. The caramelized malt taste is distinctive, and it is well balanced with the hops. The deep brown color is appealing, even with a small head. This is a great stout.

Bottled. A dark hazelnut brown with a yeasty foamy head. The aroma is malty and of oatmeal. The taste is medium bodied, dry and sweet in the finish. The taste is very smooth with oatmeal and a nice malty finish. This is a great oatmeal stout.

Aroma is very earthy. Appearance is black with a thick head that disappears quickly. Chocolate and oats are prevalent in a taste that is also quite sweet. Palate is medium bodied and smooth as hell. Overall a good beer but did not live up to expectations in my opinion .

Simply put, this is my favorite beer. At $10 for a 4-pack I don't have it often. But that just makes it better when I splurge on it.
